AG.AGLNKID: AGLNKID in AG domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGLNKGRP: AGLNKGRP in AG domain | Label: Link Group ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGTRT: AGTRT in AG domain | Label: Reported Agent Name | Description: Verbatim medication name that is either preprinted or collected on a CRF. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Interventions
AG.AGMODIFY: AGMODIFY in AG domain | Label: Modified Reported Name | Description: If AGTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then AGMODIFY will contain the modified text. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGDECOD: AGDECOD in AG domain | Label: Standardized Agent Name | Description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of AGTRT or AGMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic medication name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary, then AGDECOD will be left blank. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGCAT: AGCAT in AG domain | Label: Category for Agent | Description: Used to define a category of agent. Examples: "CHALLENGE AGENT", "PET TRACER". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGSCAT: AGSCAT in AG domain | Label: Subcategory for Agent | Description: Further categorization of agent. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGPRESP: AGPRESP in AG domain | Label: AG Pre-Specified | Description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific agent was solicited on the CRF. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGOCCUR: AGOCCUR in AG domain | Label: AG Occurrence | Description: When the use of specific agent is solicited, AGOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") use of the agent occurred. Values are null for agents not specifically solicited. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGSTAT: AGSTAT in AG domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question about a prespecified agent was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGREASND: AGREASND in AG domain | Label: Reason Procedure Agent Not Collected | Description: Describes the reason a response to a question about the occurrence of a procedure agent was not collected. Used in conjunction with AGSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGCLAS: AGCLAS in AG domain | Label: Agent Class | Description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLAS. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGCLASCD: AGCLASCD in AG domain | Label: Agent Class Code | Description: Class code corresponding to AGCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLASCD. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGDOSE: AGDOSE in AG domain | Label: Dose per Administration | Description: Amount of AGTRT taken. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGDOSTXT: AGDOSTXT in AG domain | Label: Dose Description | Description: Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Units may be stored in AGDOSU. Examples: "200-400", "15-20". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGDOSU: AGDOSU in AG domain | Label: Dose Units | Description: Units for AGDOSE and AGDOSTXT. Examples: "ng", "mg", "mg/kg". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGDOSFRM: AGDOSFRM in AG domain | Label: Dose Form | Description: Dose form for AGTRT. Examples: "TABLET", "AEROSOL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGDOSFRQ: AGDOSFRQ in AG domain | Label: Dosing Frequency per Interval | Description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of AGDOSE within a specific time period. Example: "ONCE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGROUTE: AGROUTE in AG domain | Label: Route of Administration | Description: Route of administration for AGTRT. Example: "ORAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in AG domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: 1. Clinical encounter number. \n 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Interventions
AG.VISIT: VISIT in AG domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. \n 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.VISITDY: VISITDY in AG domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.TAETORD: TAETORD in AG domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the agent administration started. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.EPOCH: EPOCH in AG domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the agent administration started. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGSTDTC: AGSTDTC in AG domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Agent | Description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by AGTRT and the dosing variables began. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGENDTC: AGENDTC in AG domain | Label: End Date/Time of Agent | Description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by AGTRT and the dosing variables ended. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGSTDY: AGSTDY in AG domain | Label: Study Day of Start of Agent | Description: Study day of start of agent relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGENDY: AGENDY in AG domain | Label: Study Day of End of Agent | Description: Study day of end of agent relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGDUR: AGDUR in AG domain | Label: Duration of Agent | Description: Collected duration for an agent episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGSTRF: AGSTRF in AG domain | Label: Start Relative to Reference Period | Description: Describes the start of the agent relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGENRF: AGENRF in AG domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Period | Description: Describes the end of the agent relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGSTRTPT: AGSTRTPT in AG domain | Label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the start of the agent as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable AGSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGSTTPT: AGSTTPT in AG domain | Label: Start Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AGSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGENRTPT: AGENRTPT in AG domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AG.AGENTPT: AGENTPT in AG domain | Label: End Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AGENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions

CM.CMPRESP: CMPRESP in CM domain | Label: CM Pre-specified | Description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific medication was solicited on the CRF. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions

CM.CMINDC: CMINDC in CM domain | Label: Indication | Description: Denotes why a medication was taken or administered. Examples: "NAUSEA", "HYPERTENSION". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
CM.CMCLAS: CMCLAS in CM domain | Label: Medication Class | Description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. CM.CMENDY: CMENDY in CM domain | Label: Study Day of End of Medication | Description: Study day of end of medication relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions

EC.ECREFID: ECREFID in EC domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions

EC.ECCAT: ECCAT in EC domain | Label: Category of Treatment | Description: Used to define a category of related ECTRT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions

EC.ECDOSE: ECDOSE in EC domain | Label: Dose | Description: Amount of ECTRT when numeric. Not populated when ECDOSTXT is populated. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Interventions

EC.ECDOSRGM: ECDOSRGM in EC domain | Label: Intended Dose Regimen | Description: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Example: "TWO WEEKS ON", "TWO WEEKS OFF". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
EC.ECROUTE: ECROUTE in EC domain | Label: Route of Administration | Description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions

PR.TAETORD: TAETORD in PR domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions

PR.PRSTDTC: PRSTDTC in PR domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Procedure | Description: Start date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Interventions
PR.PRENDTC: PRENDTC in PR domain | Label: End Date/Time of Procedure | Description: End date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRSTDY: PRSTDY in PR domain | Label: Study Day of Start of Procedure | Description: Study day of start of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRENDY: PRENDY in PR domain | Label: Study Day of End of Procedure | Description: Study day of end of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRDUR: PRDUR in PR domain | Label: Duration of Procedure | Description: Collected duration of a procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRTPT: PRTPT in PR domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a procedure should be performed. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PRTPTNUM and PRTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRTPTNUM: PRTPTNUM in PR domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRELTM: PRELTM in PR domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 format relative to a planned fixed reference (PRTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRTPTREF: PRTPTREF in PR domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by PRELTM, PRTPTNUM, and PRTPT. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRRFTDTC: PRRFTDTC in PR domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by PRTRTREF in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRSTRTPT: PRSTRTPT in PR domain | Label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRSTTPT: PRSTTPT in PR domain | Label: Start Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRENRTPT: PRENRTPT in PR domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
PR.PRENTPT: PRENTPT in PR domain | Label: End Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.STUDYID: STUDYID in SU domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Interventions
SU.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in SU domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Interventions
SU.USUBJID: USUBJID in SU domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSEQ: SUSEQ in SU domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Interventions
SU.SUGRPID: SUGRPID in SU domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSPID: SUSPID in SU domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Tobacco & Alcohol Use CRF page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUTRT: SUTRT in SU domain | Label: Reported Name of Substance | Description: Substance name. Examples: "CIGARETTES", "COFFEE". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Interventions
SU.SUMODIFY: SUMODIFY in SU domain | Label: Modified Substance Name | Description: If SUTRT is modified, then the modified text is placed here. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDECOD: SUDECOD in SU domain | Label: Standardized Substance Name | Description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of SUTRT or SUMODIFY if the sponsor chooses to code the substance use. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUCAT: SUCAT in SU domain | Label: Category for Substance Use | Description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "TOBACCO", "ALCOHOL", or "CAFFEINE". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSCAT: SUSCAT in SU domain | Label: Subcategory for Substance Use | Description: A further categorization of substance use. Examples: "CIGARS", "CIGARETTES", "BEER", "WINE". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUPRESP: SUPRESP in SU domain | Label: SU Pre-Specified | Description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific substance was solicited on the CRF. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUOCCUR: SUOCCUR in SU domain | Label: SU Occurrence | Description: When the use of specific substances is solicited, SUOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") a particular prespecified substance was used. Values are null for substances not specifically solicited. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSTAT: SUSTAT in SU domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: When the use of prespecified substances is solicited, the completion status indicates that there was no response to the question about the prespecified substance. When there is no prespecified list on the CRF, then the completion status indicates that substance use was not assessed for the subject. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUREASND: SUREASND in SU domain | Label: Reason Substance Use Not Collected | Description: Describes the reason substance use was not collected. Used in conjunction with SUSTAT when value of SUSTAT is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUCLAS: SUCLAS in SU domain | Label: Substance Use Class | Description: Substance use class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit SUCLAS. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUCLASCD: SUCLASCD in SU domain | Label: Substance Use Class Code | Description: Code corresponding to SUCLAS. May be obtained from coding. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDOSE: SUDOSE in SU domain | Label: Substance Use Consumption | Description: Amount of SUTRT consumed. Not populated if SUDOSTXT is populated. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDOSTXT: SUDOSTXT in SU domain | Label: Substance Use Consumption Text | Description: Substance use consumption amounts or a range of consumption information collected in text form. Not populated if SUDOSE is populated. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDOSU: SUDOSU in SU domain | Label: Consumption Units | Description: Units for SUDOSE, SUDOSTOT, or SUDOSTXT. Examples: "oz", "CIGARETTE", "PACK", "g". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDOSFRM: SUDOSFRM in SU domain | Label: Dose Form | Description: Dose form for SUTRT. Examples: "INJECTABLE", "LIQUID", "POWDER". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDOSFRQ: SUDOSFRQ in SU domain | Label: Use Frequency Per Interval | Description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of SUDOSE within a specific time period. Example: "Q24H" (every day). | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDOSTOT: SUDOSTOT in SU domain | Label: Total Daily Consumption | Description: Total daily use of SUTRT using the units in SUDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose. If a sponsor needs to aggregate the data over a period other than daily, then the aggregated total could be recorded in a supplemental qualifier variable. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUROUTE: SUROUTE in SU domain | Label: Route of Administration | Description: Route of administration for SUTRT. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.TAETORD: TAETORD in SU domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the substance use started. Null for substances that started before study participation. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.EPOCH: EPOCH in SU domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the substance use. Null for substances that started before study participation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSTDTC: SUSTDTC in SU domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Substance Use | Description: Start date/time of the substance use represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUENDTC: SUENDTC in SU domain | Label: End Date/Time of Substance Use | Description: End date/time of the substance use represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSTDY: SUSTDY in SU domain | Label: Study Day of Start of Substance Use | Description: Study day of start of substance use relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUENDY: SUENDY in SU domain | Label: Study Day of End of Substance Use | Description: Study day of end of substance use relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUDUR: SUDUR in SU domain | Label: Duration of Substance Use | Description: Collected duration of substance use in ISO 8601 format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSTRF: SUSTRF in SU domain | Label: Start Relative to Reference Period | Description: Describes the start of the substance use relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR" was collected, this information may be translated into SUSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUENRF: SUENRF in SU domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Period | Description: Describes the end of the substance use with relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into SUENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSTRTPT: SUSTRTPT in SU domain | Label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the start of the substance as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable SUSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7 , Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUSTTPT: SUSTTPT in SU domain | Label: Start Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUENRTPT: SUENRTPT in SU domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the end of the substance as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable SUENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7 , Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
SU.SUENTPT: SUENTPT in SU domain | Label: End Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Interventions
AE.STUDYID: STUDYID in AE domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
AE.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in AE domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
AE.USUBJID: USUBJID in AE domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
AE.SPDEVID: SPDEVID in AE domain | Label: Sponsor Device Identifier | Description: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify a specific device. Used to represent a device associated in some way with the adverse event. SPDEVID values are defined in the Device Identifiers (DI) domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESEQ: AESEQ in AE domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Events
AE.AEGRPID: AEGRPID in AE domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEREFID: AEREFID in AE domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external identifier such as a serial number on an SAE reporting form. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESPID: AESPID in AE domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. It may be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on an Adverse Events CRF page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AETERM: AETERM in AE domain | Label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event | Description: Verbatim name of the event. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
AE.AEMODIFY: AEMODIFY in AE domain | Label: Modified Reported Term | Description: If AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AELLT: AELLT in AE domain | Label: Lowest Level Term | Description: Dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AELLTCD: AELLTCD in AE domain | Label: Lowest Level Term Code | Description: Dictionary-derived code for the lowest level term. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEDECOD: AEDECOD in AE domain | Label: Dictionary-Derived Term | Description: Dictionary-derived text description of AETERM or AEMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
AE.AEPTCD: AEPTCD in AE domain | Label: Preferred Term Code | Description: Dictionary-derived code for the preferred term. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEHLT: AEHLT in AE domain | Label: High Level Term | Description: Dictionary-derived text description of the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC). | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEHLTCD: AEHLTCD in AE domain | Label: High Level Term Code | Description: Dictionary-derived code for the high level term for the primary SOC. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEHLGT: AEHLGT in AE domain | Label: High Level Group Term | Description: Dictionary-derived text description of the high level group term for the primary SOC. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEHLGTCD: AEHLGTCD in AE domain | Label: High Level Group Term Code | Description: Dictionary-derived code for the high level group term for the primary SOC. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AECAT: AECAT in AE domain | Label: Category for Adverse Event | Description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "BLEEDING", "NEUROPSYCHIATRIC". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESCAT: AESCAT in AE domain | Label: Subcategory for Adverse Event | Description: A further categorization of adverse event. Example: "NEUROLOGIC". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEPRESP: AEPRESP in AE domain | Label: Pre-Specified Adverse Event | Description: A value of "Y" indicates that this adverse event was prespecified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms). | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEBODSYS: AEBODSYS in AE domain | Label: Body System or Organ Class | Description: Dictionary derived. Body system or organ class used by the sponsor from the coding dictionary (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEBDSYCD: AEBDSYCD in AE domain | Label: Body System or Organ Class Code | Description: Dictionary derived. Code for the body system or organ class used by the sponsor. When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AESOC: AESOC in AE domain | Label: Primary System Organ Class | Description: Dictionary-derived text description of the primary SOC. Will be the same as AEBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AESOCCD: AESOCCD in AE domain | Label: Primary System Organ Class Code | Description: Dictionary-derived code for the primary SOC. Will be the same as AEBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AELOC: AELOC in AE domain | Label: Location of Event | Description: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event (e.g., "ARM" for skin rash). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESEV: AESEV in AE domain | Label: Severity/Intensity | Description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESER: AESER in AE domain | Label: Serious Event | Description: Is this a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEACN: AEACN in AE domain | Label: Action Taken with Study Treatment | Description: Describes changes to the study treatment as a result of the event. AEACN is specifically for the relationship to study treatment. AEACNOTH is for actions unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Examples of AEACN values include ICH E2B values: "DRUG WITHDRAWN", "DOSE REDUCED", "DOSE INCREASED", "DOSE NOT CHANGED", "UNKNOWN" and "NOT APPLICABLE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AEACNOTH: AEACNOTH in AE domain | Label: Other Action Taken | Description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Usually reported as free text. Example: "TREATMENT UNBLINDED. PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN NOTIFIED". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEACNDEV: AEACNDEV in AE domain | Label: Action Taken with Device | Description: An action taken with a device as the result of the event. The device may or may not be a device under study. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEREL: AEREL in AE domain | Label: Causality | Description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH does not establish any required or recommended terms for non-device relatedness. ICH E2A and E2B examples include (up-cased here for alignment to SDTM conventions) terms such as "NOT RELATED", "UNLIKELY RELATED", "POSSIBLY RELATED", "RELATED", but these example terms do not establish any conventions or expectations. Controlled terminology may be defined in the future. Check with regulatory authority for population of this variable. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
AE.AERLDEV:
AERLDEV in AE domain | Label: Relationship of Event to Device | Description: A judgment as to the likelihood that the device caused the adverse event. The relationship is to a device identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AERELNST: AERELNST in AE domain | Label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment | Description: Records the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEPATT: AEPATT in AE domain | Label: Pattern of Adverse Event | Description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: "INTERMITTENT", "CONTINUOUS", "SINGLE EVENT". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEOUT: AEOUT in AE domain | Label: Outcome of Adverse Event | Description: Description of the outcome of an event. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESCAN: AESCAN in AE domain | Label: Involves Cancer | Description: Was the serious event associated with the development of cancer? Valid values are "Y" and "N". This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESCONG: AESCONG in AE domain | Label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect | Description: Was the serious event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect? Valid values are "Y" and "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESDISAB: AESDISAB in AE domain | Label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity | Description: Did the serious event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity? Valid values are "Y" and "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESDTH: AESDTH in AE domain | Label: Results in Death | Description: Did the serious event result in death? Valid values are "Y" and "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESHOSP: AESHOSP in AE domain | Label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization | Description: Did the serious event require or prolong hospitalization? Valid values are "Y" and "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESLIFE: AESLIFE in AE domain | Label: Is Life Threatening | Description: Was the serious event life-threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESOD: AESOD in AE domain | Label: Occurred with Overdose | Description: Did the serious event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N". This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESMIE: AESMIE in AE domain | Label: Other Medically Important Serious Event | Description: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AESINTV: AESINTV in AE domain | Label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment | Description: Records whether medical or surgical intervention was necessary to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or to prevent permanent damage to a body structure, with either situation suspected to be due to the use of a medical product. This variable is used in conjunction with the other "seriousness" variables (e.g., fatal, life-threatening). It is part of the US federal government definition of a serious adverse event; see 21 CFR Part 803.3(w)(3). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AEUNANT:
AEUNANT in AE domain | Label: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effect | Description: Any serious adverse effect on health or safety or any life-threatening problem or death caused by or associated with a device, if that effect, problem, or death was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the investigational plan or application (including a supplementary plan or application), 
 or 
 any other unanticipated serious problem associated with a device that relates to the rights, safety, or welfare of subjects. (21 CFR Part 812.3(s)). 
 This variable applies only to serious AEs and should hold collected data; if the value is derived, it should be held in ADaM. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AERLPRT:
AERLPRT in AE domain | Label: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity | Description: The investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event as related to other protocol-required activities, actions, or assessments (e.g., medication changes, tests/assessments, other procedures). The relationship is to a protocol-specified, non-device-related activity where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
AE.AERLPRC:
AERLPRC in AE domain | Label: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure | Description: The investigator's opinion as to the likelihood that the device-related study procedure (e.g., implant/insertion, revision/adjustment, explant/removal) caused the AE. The relationship is to a device-related procedure where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
