HO.TAETORD: TAETORD in HO domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.EPOCH: EPOCH in HO domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the healthcare encounter. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HODTC: HODTC in HO domain | Label: Date/Time of Event Collection | Description: Collection date and time of the healthcare encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HOSTDTC: HOSTDTC in HO domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Healthcare Encounter | Description: Start date/time of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of admission). | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Events
HO.HOENDTC: HOENDTC in HO domain | Label: End Date/Time of Healthcare Encounter | Description: End date/time of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of discharge). | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HODY: HODY in HO domain | Label: Study Day of Event Collection | Description: Study day of event collection relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HOSTDY: HOSTDY in HO domain | Label: Study Day of Start of Encounter | Description: Study day of the start of the healthcare encounter relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HOENDY: HOENDY in HO domain | Label: Study Day of End of Healthcare Encounter | Description: Study day of the end of the healthcare encounter relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HODUR: HODUR in HO domain | Label: Duration of Healthcare Encounter | Description: Collected duration of the healthcare encounter. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from the start and end date/times. Example: "P1DT2H" (for 1 day, 2 hours). | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HOSTRTPT: HOSTRTPT in HO domain | Label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HOSTTPT: HOSTTPT in HO domain | Label: Start Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HOENRTPT: HOENRTPT in HO domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable HOENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
HO.HOENTPT: HOENTPT in HO domain | Label: End Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by HOENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.STUDYID: STUDYID in MH domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
MH.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in MH domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
MH.USUBJID: USUBJID in MH domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
MH.MHSEQ: MHSEQ in MH domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Events
MH.MHGRPID: MHGRPID in MH domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHREFID: MHREFID in MH domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external medical history identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHSPID: MHSPID in MH domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Medical History CRF page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHTERM: MHTERM in MH domain | Label: Reported Term for the Medical History | Description: Verbatim or preprinted CRF term for the medical condition or event. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Events
MH.MHMODIFY: MHMODIFY in MH domain | Label: Modified Reported Term | Description: If MHTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then MHMODIFY will contain the modified text. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHDECOD: MHDECOD in MH domain | Label: Dictionary-Derived Term | Description: Dictionary-derived text description of MHTERM or MHMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHEVDTYP: MHEVDTYP in MH domain | Label: Medical History Event Date Type | Description: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or the MHENDTC is defined. Examples: "DIAGNOSIS", "SYMPTOMS", "RELAPSE", "INFECTION". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHCAT: MHCAT in MH domain | Label: Category for Medical History | Description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "CARDIAC", "GENERAL". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHSCAT: MHSCAT in MH domain | Label: Subcategory for Medical History | Description: A further categorization of the condition or event. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHPRESP: MHPRESP in MH domain | Label: Medical History Event Pre-Specified | Description: A value of "Y" indicates that this medical history event was prespecified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms). | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHOCCUR: MHOCCUR in MH domain | Label: Medical History Occurrence | Description: Used when the occurrence of specific medical history conditions is solicited, to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") a medical condition (MHTERM) had ever occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHSTAT: MHSTAT in MH domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: The status indicates that the prespecified question was not asked/answered. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHREASND: MHREASND in MH domain | Label: Reason Medical History Not Collected | Description: Describes the reason why data for a prespecified condition was not collected. Used in conjunction with MHSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHBODSYS: MHBODSYS in MH domain | Label: Body System or Organ Class | Description: Dictionary-derived. Body system or organ class that is involved in an event or measurement from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables which may not necessarily be the primary SOC. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.TAETORD: TAETORD in MH domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.EPOCH: EPOCH in MH domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the medical history event. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHDTC: MHDTC in MH domain | Label: Date/Time of History Collection | Description: Collection date and time of the medical history observation represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHSTDTC: MHSTDTC in MH domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Medical History Event | Description: Start date/time of the medical history event represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHENDTC: MHENDTC in MH domain | Label: End Date/Time of Medical History Event | Description: End date/time of the medical history event. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHDY: MHDY in MH domain | Label: Study Day of History Collection | Description: Study day of medical history collection, measured as integer day. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHENRF: MHENRF in MH domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Period | Description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHENRTPT: MHENRTPT in MH domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable MHENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
MH.MHENTPT: MHENTPT in MH domain | Label: End Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by MHENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Events
BS.STUDYID: STUDYID in BS domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
BS.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in BS domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
BS.USUBJID: USUBJID in BS domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
BS.SPDEVID: SPDEVID in BS domain | Label: Sponsor Device Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSSEQ: BSSEQ in BS domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
BS.BSGRPID: BSGRPID in BS domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSREFID: BSREFID in BS domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSSPID: BSSPID in BS domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSTESTCD: BSTESTCD in BS domain | Label: Biospecimen Test Short Name | Description: Short character value for BSTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: VOLUME, RIN. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
BS.BSTEST: BSTEST in BS domain | Label: Biospecimen Test Name | Description: Long name for BSTESTCD. Examples: Volume, RNA Integrity Number. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
BS.BSCAT: BSCAT in BS domain | Label: Category for Biospecimen Test | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: MEASUREMENT, QUALITY. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSSCAT: BSSCAT in BS domain | Label: Subcategory for Biospecimen Test | Description: Used to define a further categorization of BSCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSORRES: BSORRES in BS domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSORRESU: BSORRESU in BS domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Unit for BSORRES. Examples: mg, mL. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSSTRESC: BSSTRESC in BS domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from BSORRES in a standard format or standard units. BSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in BSSTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSSTRESN: BSSTRESN in BS domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from BSSTRESC. BSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSSTRESU: BSSTRESU in BS domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for BSSTRESC and BSSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSSTAT: BSSTAT in BS domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a test was not done, or was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSREASND: BSREASND in BS domain | Label: Reason Test Not Done | Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with BSSTAT when value is NOT DONE. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSNAM: BSNAM in BS domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSSPEC: BSSPEC in BS domain | Label: Specimen Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE, SOFT TISSUE. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSANTREG: BSANTREG in BS domain | Label: Anatomical Region of Specimen | Description: Defines the specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue, organ specimen or the region from which the specimen is obtained, as defined in the protocol, such as a section or part of what is described in the BSSPEC variable. Examples: CORTEX, MEDULLA, MUCOSA. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSSPCCND: BSSPCCND in BS domain | Label: Specimen Condition | Description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Examples: HEMOLYZED, ICTERIC, LIPEMIC. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSMETHOD: BSMETHOD in BS domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: SPECTROPHOTOMETRY, ELECTROPHORESIS. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSBLFL: BSBLFL in BS domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in BS domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.VISIT: VISIT in BS domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.VISITDY: VISITDY in BS domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSDTC: BSDTC in BS domain | Label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: Date and time of specimen collection. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
BS.BSDY: BSDY in BS domain | Label: Study Day of Specimen Collection | Description: Study day of specimen collection relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSTPT: BSTPT in BS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See BSTPTNUM and BSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSTPTNUM: BSTPTNUM in BS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of BSTPT used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSELTM: BSELTM in BS domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (BSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSTPTREF: BSTPTREF in BS domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by BSELTM, BSTPTNUM, and BSTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
BS.BSRFTDTC: BSRFTDTC in BS domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by BSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.STUDYID: STUDYID in CP domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CP.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in CP domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CP.USUBJID: USUBJID in CP domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CP.CPSEQ: CPSEQ in CP domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CP.CPGRPID: CPGRPID in CP domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPREFID: CPREFID in CP domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external specimen identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSPID: CPSPID in CP domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the lab page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPLNKID: CPLNKID in CP domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPLNKGRP: CPLNKGRP in CP domain | Label: Link Group ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPTESTCD: CPTESTCD in CP domain | Label: Test or Examination Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CPTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CPTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). CPTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MONO", "MNS". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CP.CPTEST: CPTEST in CP domain | Label: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination | Description: Long name for CPTESTCD. For cell phenotyping, the name (often abbreviated) of the cell population, as it is generally accepted by the scientific community, is populated (rather than a colloquial designation based on a primary marker, e.g., TLym Help rather than CD4). When the test is for a sublineage which can only be identified by specifying additional markers (i.e., has not been given a name) or which is further restricted to a subpopulation based on a particular cell state (e.g., activated, proliferating, apoptotic), the Sublineage Marker String (CPSBMRKS), Cell State (CPCELSTA), and Cell State Marker String (CPCSMRKS) variables are additionally populated and the value in CPTEST is suffixed with "Sub" to denote that it is a subset of the population identified in CPTEST (e.g., Monocytes Sub). \n The value in CPTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CP.CPSBMRKS: CPSBMRKS in CP domain | Label: Sublineage Marker String | Description: Used to further subset the cell population identified in CPTEST based on the use of additional marker(s) that define a sublineage. The value in CPSBMRKS is used in combination with values in CPTEST and CPCELSTA to fully describe the cell population being measured. As such, it is an essential component of the full test name. \n For example, three unnamed sublineages of monocytes have been identified as: CCR2+CD16-, CCR2-CD16+, and CCR2+CD16+. Whereas the entire monocyte cell population can be defined as CD14+ cells, the additional CCR2 and CD16 markers are used to differentiate one sublineage from another. As none of these sublineages have been given names, they are only known by the CCR2 and CD16 marker combinations. By associating the CPTEST value of "Monocytes Sub" with, for example, a value of "CCR2+CD16-" in CPSBMRKS, the full test is defined to be the CCR2+CD16- monocyte subpopulation. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPCELSTA: CPCELSTA in CP domain | Label: Cell State | Description: A textual description of a subset of the cell population identified in CPTEST based on a particular functional and/or biological state (e.g., "ACTIVATED", "PROLIFERATING", "SENESCENT"). When populated, the values in CPCELSTA and CPSMRKS, in combination with the values in CPTEST and CPSBMRKS, fully describe the cell population being measured. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPCSMRKS: CPCSMRKS in CP domain | Label: Cell State Marker String | Description: Identifies the marker(s) or indicator(s) used to define the cell state (i.e., the value in CPCELSTA). \n For example, when Ki67 expression is used to determine that a cell population is in a proliferating state (i.e., CPCELSTA value="PROLIFERATING"), the value "Ki67+" in CPCSMRKS indicates that positive expression of Ki67 was used to define the population as proliferating. Similarly, a value of "Ki67-" in CPCSMRKS would indicate that lack of expression of Ki67 defined the "NON-PROLIFERATING" cell state in CPCELSTA. The CPCSMRKS value is useful for quickly determining which marker(s) were used to classify (i.e., operationally define) a cell population based on a functional/biological state. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPTSTCND: CPTSTCND in CP domain | Label: Test Condition | Description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed. --TSTCND is generally used to distinguish between two or more records where the same assay is performed under varying (as opposed to fixed) conditions, usually for the purpose of making a comparison. For example, when the same assay (identified in --TEST) is performed under stimulated and non-stimulated conditions, the --TSTCND variable is used distinguish between the records. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPCNDAGT: CPCNDAGT in CP domain | Label: Test Condition Agent | Description: The textual description of the agent, if applicable, used to impose the condition identified in CPTSTCND. For example, records might be produced for the same assay run under stimulating (CPTSTCND value = "STIMULATED") conditions produced by different stimulating agents (e.g., phorbol myristate acetate, concanavalin A, PHA-P, TNF-alpha, Ionomycin, candida antigen). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPBDAGNT: CPBDAGNT in CP domain | Label: Binding Agent | Description: The textual description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the CPTEST variable. The CPBDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the CPTEST and CPBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n The binding agent may be, but is not limited to, a test article; a portion of a test article; a substance related to a test article; an endogenous molecule; an allergen; an infectious agent; or a reagent (e.g., primary antibody) that confers the binding specificity for the measurement defined in CPTEST when it is needed to uniquely identify the test. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPABCLID: CPABCLID in CP domain | Label: Antibody Clone Identifier | Description: Identifies the antibody clone (e.g., supplier-provided catalog name) used to confer specificity for the binding agent specified in CPBDAGNT. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPMRKSTR: CPMRKSTR in CP domain | Label: Marker String | Description: The text string identifying the full set of markers/indicators used by the laboratory to operationally define the complete test based on the combination of CPTEST, CPSBMRKS, and CPCELSTA. Because laboratories often use different markers/indicators to identify a cell population, the relationship between a named cell population in CPTEST (as combined with CPSBMRKS and CPCELSTA values) and the set of markers used to identify that population is many-to-one. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different sets of markers, it is necessary to operationally define the test in terms of the complete set of markers/indicators used to perform that test. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CP.CPGATE: CPGATE in CP domain | Label: Gate | Description: The sponsor-defined name assigned to a gate. Gates are electronic (i.e., a device setting or software-defined) boundaries set by a user to virtually parse a specimen into discrete populations based on a set of defined characteristics (e.g., presence, absence, or intensity of expression of various markers; physical size; internal complexity or granularity). Gates are used to constrain data collection or analysis to a specific cell population or region of interest within the specimen. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPGATDEF: CPGATDEF in CP domain | Label: Gate Definition | Description: The text string identifying the set of parameters and the order in which they are applied to define the gating strategy. In practice, a series of 2-dimensional sub-gates based on different cell characteristics (i.e., markers/indicators/physical properties) are most often combined until the cell population of interest is sufficiently resolved (i.e., electronically isolated) from other cell populations contained within the specimen. \n For complex analyses, differences in gating strategies can produce subtle differences in results obtained for a test. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different gating strategies, it is often necessary to qualify the test in terms of the gating strategy. For some purposes, however, and at the discretion of the sponsor, only the ultimate or penultimate gate is identified. When specifying the gating strategy in CPGATDEF, each sub-gate should be listed in the order it was applied and separated from the next sub-gate using the pipe/vertical line ("|") character. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSPTSTD: CPSPTSTD in CP domain | Label: Sponsor Test Description | Description: Sponsor's description of a test. The variable is intended to contain highly structured test description metadata used by a sponsor to unambiguously define (label) a test. Such values generally reside in a sponsor/laboratory test metadata repository. CPSPTSTD is not intended for unstructured (spontaneous) free text. \n An example of appropriate usage is when it is necessary to include identifying information for a target cell population on which a test is conducted when the target population is not part of the test name, e.g., tests for quantitative expression of a particular marker on a specific cell population. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPCAT: CPCAT in CP domain | Label: Category | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects. Examples: "IMMUNOPHENOTYPING", "CELL FUNCTION", "TARGET ENGAGEMENT". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSCAT: CPSCAT in CP domain | Label: Subcategory | Description: A further categorization of CPCAT. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPTSTPNL: CPTSTPNL in CP domain | Label: Test Panel | Description: Sponsor-defined textual description used to group tests run together as part of a test panel. Can be used with --GRPID to ensure that relationships between associated tests are accurately identified. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPORRES: CPORRES in CP domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CP.CPORRESU: CPORRESU in CP domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for CPORRES. Examples: "10^6/L", "%", "MESF". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPRESSCL: CPRESSCL in CP domain | Label: Result Scale | Description: Classifies the scale of the original result value with respect to whether the result is quantitative, ordinal, nominal, or narrative. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPRESTYP: CPRESTYP in CP domain | Label: Result Type | Description: Classifies the kind of result (i.e., property type) originally reported for the test. Examples: "NUMBER CONCENTRATION", "NUMBER FRACTION", "RATIO". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPCOLSRT: CPCOLSRT in CP domain | Label: Collected Summary Result Type | Description: Used to indicate the type of collected summary result. This includes source summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). If the summary result is derived using individual source data records, this summary result should be represented in ADaM. If a sponsor has both a collected summary result and a derived summary result, the collected summary result should be represented in SDTM and the derived summary result should be represented in ADaM. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPORNRLO: CPORNRLO in CP domain | Label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit | Description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPORNRHI: CPORNRHI in CP domain | Label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit | Description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSTRESC: CPSTRESC in CP domain | Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from CPORRES in a standard format or in standard units. CPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CPSTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CP.CPSTRESN: CPSTRESN in CP domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from CPSTRESC. CPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSTRESU: CPSTRESU in CP domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for CPSTRESC or CPSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSTNRLO: CPSTNRLO in CP domain | Label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units | Description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for CPSTRESC/CPSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSTNRHI: CPSTNRHI in CP domain | Label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units | Description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPNRIND: CPNRIND in CP domain | Label: Reference Range Indicator | Description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by CPORNRLO and CPORNRHI, CPSTNRLO and CPSTNRHI, or by CPSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether CPNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. CPNRIND should not be used to indicate clinical significance. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSTAT: CPSTAT in CP domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that the test was not performed or that it was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null if a result exists in CPORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPREASND: CPREASND in CP domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a test was not performed, e.g., "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED", "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with CPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPNAM: CPNAM in CP domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: The name or identifier of the laboratory that performed the test. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPLOINC: CPLOINC in CP domain | Label: LOINC Code | Description: Code for the test from the LOINC code system. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSPEC: CPSPEC in CP domain | Label: Specimen Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "BLOOD", "BONE MARROW". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPSPCCND: CPSPCCND in CP domain | Label: Specimen Condition | Description: The physical state or quality of a specimen for an assessment. Example: "CLOTTED". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPMETHOD: CPMETHOD in CP domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Example: "FLOW CYTOMETRY". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPANMETH: CPANMETH in CP domain | Label: Analysis Method | Description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPLOBXFL: CPLOBXFL in CP domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPBLFL: CPBLFL in CP domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPDRVFL: CPDRVFL in CP domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If CPDRVFL = "Y", then CPORRES may be null, with CPSTRESC and (if numeric) CPSTRESN having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPCLSIG: CPCLSIG in CP domain | Label: Clinically Significant, Collected | Description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgement. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in CP domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.VISIT: VISIT in CP domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.VISITDY: VISITDY in CP domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.TAETORD: TAETORD in CP domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.EPOCH: EPOCH in CP domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPDTC: CPDTC in CP domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CP.CPDY: CPDY in CP domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Study day of specimen collection, measured in integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC value in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPTPT: CPTPT in CP domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a specimen is to be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (i.e., to the value in CPTPTREF). Example: "1 hour post". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPTPTNUM: CPTPTNUM in CP domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of CPTPT to aid in sorting. When CPTPT is represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (i.e., to the value in CPTPTREF), the values in CPTPTNUM should be assigned in ascending order relative to the value in CPTPTREF. For example, records for time points where CPTPT = "5 minutes post", 1 hour post", and "4 hours post" could be represented in CPTPTNUM as "1", "2", and "3", which maintains the order between CPTPT and CPTPTNUM with respect to the fixed time point reference in CPTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPELTM: CPELTM in CP domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time relative to the planned fixed reference value in CPTPTREF, represented in ISO 8601 duration format. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent 15 minutes prior to the reference time point indicated by CPTPTREF, "T8H" to represent 8 hours after the reference time point represented by CPTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPTPTREF: CPTPTREF in CP domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Descriptive name of the fixed reference point referred to by CPTPT, CPTPTNUM, and CPELTM. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CP.CPRFTDTC: CPRFTDTC in CP domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by CPTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.STUDYID: STUDYID in CV domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CV.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in CV domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CV.USUBJID: USUBJID in CV domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CV.CVSEQ: CVSEQ in CV domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CV.CVGRPID: CVGRPID in CV domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVREFID: CVREFID in CV domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Optional internal or external identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVSPID: CVSPID in CV domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: a preprinted line identifier on a CRF. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVLNKID: CVLNKID in CV domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVLNKGRP: CVLNKGRP in CV domain | Label: Link Group | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVTESTCD: CVTESTCD in CV domain | Label: Short Name of Cardiovascular Test | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" would not be valid). CVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CV.CVTEST: CVTEST in CV domain | Label: Name of Cardiovascular Test | Description: Long name For CVTESTCD. The value in CVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
CV.CVCAT: CVCAT in CV domain | Label: Category for Cardiovascular Test | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVSCAT: CVSCAT in CV domain | Label: Subcategory for Cardiovascular Test | Description: Used to define a further categorization of CVCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVPOS: CVPOS in CV domain | Label: Position of Subject During Observation | Description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVORRES: CVORRES in CV domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CV.CVORRESU: CVORRESU in CV domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. Unit for CVORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVSTRESC: CVSTRESC in CV domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived, from CVORRES in a standard format or in standard units. CVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CVSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in CVORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in CVSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CV.CVSTRESN: CVSTRESN in CV domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from CVSTRESC. CVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVSTRESU: CVSTRESU in CV domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for CVSTRESC and CVSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVSTAT: CVSTAT in CV domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVREASND: CVREASND in CV domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed (e.g., "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED"). Used in conjunction with CVSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVLOC: CVLOC in CV domain | Label: Location Used for the Measurement | Description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "HEART", "LEFT VENTRICLE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVLAT: CVLAT in CV domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL", "UNILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVDIR: CVDIR in CV domain | Label: Directionality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVMETHOD: CVMETHOD in CV domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method used to create the result. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVLOBXFL: CVLOBXFL in CV domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CV.CVBLFL: CVBLFL in CV domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that CVBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVDRVFL: CVDRVFL in CV domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (i.e., a record that represents the average of other records, such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVEVAL: CVEVAL in CV domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", " INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVEVALID: CVEVALID in CV domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in CVEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in CV domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CV.VISIT: VISIT in CV domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.VISITDY: VISITDY in CV domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.TAETORD: TAETORD in CV domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.EPOCH: EPOCH in CV domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVDTC: CVDTC in CV domain | Label: Date/Time of Test | Description: Collection date and time of an observation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
CV.CVDY: CVDY in CV domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVTPT: CVTPT in CV domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See CVTPTNUM and CVTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVTPTNUM: CVTPTNUM in CV domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVELTM: CVELTM in CV domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (CVTPTREF). Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVTPTREF: CVTPTREF in CV domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by CVELTM, CVTPTNUM, and CVTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
CV.CVRFTDTC: CVRFTDTC in CV domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by CVTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings

DA.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in DA domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DA.USUBJID: USUBJID in DA domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DA.DASEQ: DASEQ in DA domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DA.DAGRPID: DAGRPID in DA domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DAREFID: DAREFID in DA domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Optional internal or external identifier such as a code from the product packaging (e.g., bottle label, package label, kit label). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DASPID: DASPID in DA domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. DA.DALNKID: DALNKID in DA domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DALNKGRP: DALNKGRP in DA domain | Label: Link Group ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DATESTCD: DATESTCD in DA domain | Label: Short Name of Accountability Assessment | Description: Short character value for DATEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. DA.DATEST: DATEST in DA domain | Label: Name of Accountability Assessment | Description: Verbatim name corresponding to the topic variable of the test or examination used to obtain the product accountability assessment. The value in DATEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Dispensed Amount", "Returned Amount". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DA.DACAT: DACAT in DA domain | Label: Category | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "STUDY MEDICATION", "RESCUE MEDICATION". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DASCAT: DASCAT in DA domain | Label: Subcategory | Description: Used to define a further categorization level for a group of related records. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DAORRES: DAORRES in DA domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the product accountability assessment as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
DA.DAORRESU: DAORRESU in DA domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Unit for DAORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DASTRESC: DASTRESC in DA domain | Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format | Description: Contains the result value for all product accountability assessments copied or derived from DAORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. DASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DASTRESU: DASTRESU in DA domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for DASTRESC and DASTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DASTAT: DASTAT in DA domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a product accountability assessment was not done. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DAREASND: DAREASND in DA domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with DASTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in DA domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
DA.VISIT: VISIT in DA domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.VISITDY: VISITDY in DA domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit, based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.TAETORD: TAETORD in DA domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm (see Section 7.2.1, Trial Arms). | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.EPOCH: EPOCH in DA domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DA.DADTC: DADTC in DA domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Date and time of the product accountability assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
DA.DADY: DADY in DA domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Study day of product accountability assessment, measured in integer days. DD.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in DD domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DD.USUBJID: USUBJID in DD domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DD.DDSEQ: DDSEQ in DD domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DD.DDTESTCD: DDTESTCD in DD domain | Label: Death Detail Assessment Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in DDTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DDTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). DDTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "PRCDTH", "SECDTH". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DD.DDTEST: DDTEST in DD domain | Label: Death Detail Assessment Name | Description: Long name for DDTESTCD. The value in DDTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Primary Cause of Death", "Secondary Cause of Death". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
DD.DDORRES: DDORRES in DD domain | Label: Result or Finding as Collected | Description: Result of the test defined in DDTEST, as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
DD.DDSTRESC: DDSTRESC in DD domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result or finding copied or derived from DDORRES in a standard format. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
DD.DDRESCAT: DDRESCAT in DD domain | Label: Result Category | Description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Examples: "TREATMENT RELATED", "NONTREATMENT RELATED", "UNDETERMINED", "ACCIDENTAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DD.DDEVAL: DDEVAL in DD domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
DD.DDDTC: DDDTC in DD domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Date/time of collection of the diagnosis or other death assessment data in ISO 8601 format. This is not necessarily the date of death. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
DD.DDDY: DDDY in DD domain | Label: Study Day of Collection | Description: Study day of the collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.STUDYID: STUDYID in EG domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
EG.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in EG domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
EG.USUBJID: USUBJID in EG domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
EG.SPDEVID: SPDEVID in EG domain | Label: Sponsor Device Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGSEQ: EGSEQ in EG domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
EG.EGGRPID: EGGRPID in EG domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGREFID: EGREFID in EG domain | Label: ECG Reference ID | Description: Internal or external ECG identifier. Example: "334PT89". | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGSPID: EGSPID in EG domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the ECG page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGBEATNO: EGBEATNO in EG domain | Label: ECG Beat Number | Description: A sequence number that identifies the beat within an ECG. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGTESTCD: EGTESTCD in EG domain | Label: ECG Test or Examination Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in EGTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in EGTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). EGTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "PRAG", "QRSAG". \n Test codes are in 2 separate codelists, 1 for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTESTCD) and one 1 tests based on Holter monitoring (HETESTCD). | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
EG.EGTEST: EGTEST in EG domain | Label: ECG Test or Examination Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in EGTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "PR Interval, Aggregate", "QRS Duration, Aggregate". \n Test names are in 2 separate codelists, 1 for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTEST) and 1 for tests based on Holter monitoring (HETEST). | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
EG.EGCAT: EGCAT in EG domain | Label: Category for ECG | Description: Used to categorize ECG observations across subjects. Examples: "MEASUREMENT", "FINDING", "INTERVAL". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGSCAT: EGSCAT in EG domain | Label: Subcategory for ECG | Description: A further categorization of the ECG. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGPOS: EGPOS in EG domain | Label: ECG Position of Subject | Description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGORRES: EGORRES in EG domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the ECG measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples of expected values are "62" or "0.151" when the result is an interval or measurement, or "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION" or "QT PROLONGATION" when the result is a finding. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
EG.EGORRESU: EGORRESU in EG domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for EGORRES. Examples: "sec", "msec". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGSTRESC: EGSTRESC in EG domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from EGORRES, in a standard format or standard units. EGSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in EGSTRESN. For example, if a test has results of 62 beats/min, then EGORRES = "62", EGORRESU = "beats/min", EGSTRESC = "62", EGSTRESN = 62, and EGSTRESU = "beats/min" . For other examples, see Original and Standardized Results. Additional examples of result data: "SINUS BRADYCARDIA", "ATRIAL FLUTTER", "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION". \n Test results are in 3 separate codelists: EGSTRESC for abnormal test results based on regular 10-second ECGs; HESTRESC for abnormal test results based on Holter monitoring, and NORMABNM for generic test results and/or responses to EGTEST = "Interpretation". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
EG.EGSTRESN: EGSTRESN in EG domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from EGSTRESC. EGSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGSTRESU: EGSTRESU in EG domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGSTAT: EGSTAT in EG domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate an ECG was not done, or an ECG measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in EGORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGREASND: EGREASND in EG domain | Label: Reason ECG Not Done | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with EGSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGXFN: EGXFN in EG domain | Label: ECG External File Path | Description: File name and path for the external ECG waveform file. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGNAM: EGNAM in EG domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor providing the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGMETHOD: EGMETHOD in EG domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the ECG test. Example: "12-LEAD STANDARD". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGLEAD: EGLEAD in EG domain | Label: Lead Location Used for Measurement | Description: The lead used for the measurement. Examples: "LEAD 1", "LEAD 2", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGLOBXFL: EGLOBXFL in EG domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
EG.EGBLFL: EGBLFL in EG domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that EGBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGDRVFL: EGDRVFL in EG domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If EGDRVFL="Y", then EGORRES could be null, with EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN (if the result is numeric) having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGEVAL: EGEVAL in EG domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGEVALID: EGEVALID in EG domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in EGEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST 1" or "RADIOLOGIST 2". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGCLSIG: EGCLSIG in EG domain | Label: Clinically Significant, Collected | Description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGREPNUM: EGREPNUM in EG domain | Label: Repetition Number | Description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in EG domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
EG.VISIT: VISIT in EG domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.VISITDY: VISITDY in EG domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.TAETORD: TAETORD in EG domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EPOCH: EPOCH in EG domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGDTC: EGDTC in EG domain | Label: Date/Time of ECG | Description: Date/Time of ECG. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
EG.EGDY: EGDY in EG domain | Label: Study Day of ECG | Description: Study day of the ECG, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGTPT: EGTPT in EG domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See EGTPTNUM and EGTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGTPTNUM: EGTPTNUM in EG domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of EGTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGELTM: EGELTM in EG domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (EGTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGTPTREF: EGTPTREF in EG domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by EGELTM, EGTPTNUM, and EGTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
EG.EGRFTDTC: EGRFTDTC in EG domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by EGTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.STUDYID: STUDYID in FT domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
FT.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in FT domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
FT.USUBJID: USUBJID in FT domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
FT.FTSEQ: FTSEQ in FT domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
FT.FTGRPID: FTGRPID in FT domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTREFID: FTREFID in FT domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Optional internal or external identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTSPID: FTSPID in FT domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the Test page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTTESTCD: FTTESTCD in FT domain | Label: Short Name of Test | Description: Short character value for FTTEST, which can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FTTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. \n Controlled terminology for FTTESTCD is published in separate codelists for each instrument. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/terminology/controlled-terminology for values for FTTESTCD. Examples: "W250101", "W25F0102". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
FT.FTTEST: FTTEST in FT domain | Label: Name of Test | Description: Verbatim name of the question used to obtain the finding. The value in FTTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n Controlled terminology for FTTEST is published in separate codelists for each instrument. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/terminology/controlled-terminology for values for FTTEST. Examples: "W2501-25 Foot Walk Time", "W25F-More Than Two Attempts". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
FT.FTCAT: FTCAT in FT domain | Label: Category | Description: Used to specify the functional test in which the functional test question identified by FTTEST and FTTESTCD was included. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
FT.FTSCAT: FTSCAT in FT domain | Label: Subcategory | Description: Used to define a further categorization of FTCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTPOS: FTPOS in FT domain | Label: Position of Subject During Observation | Description: Position of the subject during the test. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
