FT.FTORRES: FTORRES in FT domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
FT.FTORRESU: FTORRESU in FT domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. Unit for FTORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTSTRESC: FTSTRESC in FT domain | Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FTORRES in a standard format or in standard units. FTSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FTSTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
FT.FTSTRESN: FTSTRESN in FT domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FTSTRESC. FTSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTSTRESU: FTSTRESU in FT domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for FTSTRESC and FTSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTSTAT: FTSTAT in FT domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTREASND: FTREASND in FT domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Used in conjunction with FTSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTXFN: FTXFN in FT domain | Label: External File Path | Description: File path to an external file. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTNAM: FTNAM in FT domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the vendor or laboratory that provided the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTMETHOD: FTMETHOD in FT domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTLOBXFL: FTLOBXFL in FT domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
FT.FTBLFL: FTBLFL in FT domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as FTLOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FTBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTDRVFL: FTDRVFL in FT domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTREPNUM: FTREPNUM in FT domain | Label: Repetition Number | Description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in FT domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
FT.VISIT: VISIT in FT domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.VISITDY: VISITDY in FT domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.TAETORD: TAETORD in FT domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.EPOCH: EPOCH in FT domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the functional tests finding. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTDTC: FTDTC in FT domain | Label: Date/Time of Test | Description: Collection date and time of functional test. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
FT.FTDY: FTDY in FT domain | Label: Study Day of Test | Description: Actual study day of test expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTTPT: FTTPT in FT domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See FTTPTNUM and FTTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTTPTNUM: FTTPTNUM in FT domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTELTM: FTELTM in FT domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (FTTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTTPTREF: FTTPTREF in FT domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by FTELTM, FTTPTNUM, and FTTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FT.FTRFTDTC: FTRFTDTC in FT domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by FTTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.STUDYID: STUDYID in GF domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
GF.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in GF domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
GF.USUBJID: USUBJID in GF domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
GF.SPDEVID: SPDEVID in GF domain | Label: Sponsor Device Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.NHOID: NHOID in GF domain | Label: Non-Host Organism Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSEQ: GFSEQ in GF domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
GF.GFGRPID: GFGRPID in GF domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFREFID: GFREFID in GF domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: A unique identifier for the assayed genetic specimen. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
GF.GFSPID: GFSPID in GF domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFLNKID: GFLNKID in GF domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFLNKGRP: GFLNKGRP in GF domain | Label: Link Group ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFTESTCD: GFTESTCD in GF domain | Label: Short Name of Genomic Measurement | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in GFTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in GFTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). GFTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
GF.GFTEST: GFTEST in GF domain | Label: Name of Genomic Measurement | Description: Long name for GFTESTCD. The value in GFTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
GF.GFTSTDTL: GFTSTDTL in GF domain | Label: Measurement, Test, or Examination Detail | Description: Description of a reportable qualifying the assessment in GFTESTCD and GFTEST. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFCAT: GFCAT in GF domain | Label: Category for Genomic Finding | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSCAT: GFSCAT in GF domain | Label: Subcategory for Genomic Finding | Description: Used to define a further categorization of GFCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFORRES: GFORRES in GF domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
GF.GFORRESU: GFORRESU in GF domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Unit for GFORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFORREF: GFORREF in GF domain | Label: Reference Result in Original Units | Description: Reference value for the result or finding as originally received or collected. GFORREF uses the same units as GFORRES, if applicable. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSTRESC: GFSTRESC in GF domain | Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from GFORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. GFSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in GFSTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
GF.GFSTRESN: GFSTRESN in GF domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from GFSTRESC. GFSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSTRESU: GFSTRESU in GF domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for GFSTRESC, GFSTRESN, GFSTREFC, and GFSTREFN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSTREFC: GFSTREFC in GF domain | Label: Reference Result in Standard Format | Description: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from GFORREF in a standard format. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSTREFN: GFSTREFN in GF domain | Label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units | Description: Reference value for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format or in standard units. GFSTREFN uses the same units as GFSTRESN, if applicable. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFRESCAT: GFRESCAT in GF domain | Label: Result Category | Description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFINHERT: GFINHERT in GF domain | Label: Inheritability | Description: Identifies whether the variation can be passed to the next generation. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFGENREF: GFGENREF in GF domain | Label: Genome Reference | Description: An identifier for the genome reference used to generate the reported result. For example, Genome Reference Consortium Human Build 38 patch release 13 may be represented as "GRCh38.p13". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFCHROM: GFCHROM in GF domain | Label: Chromosome Identifier | Description: The designation (name or number) of the chromosome or contig on which the variant or other feature appears (e.g., "17"; "X"). | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSYM: GFSYM in GF domain | Label: Genomic Symbol | Description: A published symbol for the portion of the genome serving as a locus for the experiment/test. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSYMTYP: GFSYMTYP in GF domain | Label: Genomic Symbol Type | Description: A description of the type of genomic entity that is represented by the published symbol in GFSYM. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFGENLOC: GFGENLOC in GF domain | Label: Genetic Location | Description: Specifies the location within a sequence for the observed value in GFORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFGENSR: GFGENSR in GF domain | Label: Genetic Sub-Region | Description: The portion of the locus in which the variation was found. Examples: "Exon 15", "Kinase domain". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSEQID: GFSEQID in GF domain | Label: Sequence Identifier \n | Description: A unique identifier for the sequence used as the reference to identify the genetic variation in the result. Examples: "NM_001234", "ENSG00000182533", "ENST00000343849.2". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFPVRID: GFPVRID in GF domain | Label: Published Variant Identifier | Description: A unique identifier for the variation that has been publicly characterized in an external database. Examples: "rs2231142", "COSM41596". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFCOPYID: GFCOPYID in GF domain | Label: Copy Identifier | Description: An arbitrary identifier used to differentiate between copies of a genetic target of interest present on homologous chromosomes. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSTAT: GFSTAT in GF domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFREASND: GFREASND in GF domain | Label: Reason Test Not Done | Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with GFSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFXFN: GFXFN in GF domain | Label: External File Path | Description: The filename and/or path to external data not stored in the same format and possibly not the same location as the other data for a study. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFNAM: GFNAM in GF domain | Label: Laboratory/Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the vendor that provided the test result. When more than 1 vendor is involved in the generation of the result, additional vendors should be represented as supplemental qualifiers. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFSPEC: GFSPEC in GF domain | Label: Specimen Material Type | Description: Identifies the type of genetic material used for the measurement. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFMETHOD: GFMETHOD in GF domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: The test method by which the examination is performed by the wet lab in order to yield the result reported in the dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
GF.GFRUNID: GFRUNID in GF domain | Label: Run ID | Description: A unique identifier for a particular run of a test performed by the wet lab on a particular batch of samples. This identifier can be used to distinguish between records for the same test performed at different times. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFANMETH: GFANMETH in GF domain | Label: Analysis Method | Description: The method of secondary processing performed by the dry lab to yield the result reported in the dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFBLFL: GFBLFL in GF domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFDRVFL: GFDRVFL in GF domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFLLOQ: GFLLOQ in GF domain | Label: Lower Limit of Quantitation | Description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for GFSTRESU. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFREPNUM: GFREPNUM in GF domain | Label: Repetition Number | Description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test performed by the wet lab. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in GF domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
GF.VISIT: VISIT in GF domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.VISITDY: VISITDY in GF domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFDTC: GFDTC in GF domain | Label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: Date and time of specimen collection. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
GF.GFDY: GFDY in GF domain | Label: Study Day of Specimen Collection | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFTPT: GFTPT in GF domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See GFTPTNUM and GFTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFTPTNUM: GFTPTNUM in GF domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of GFTPT used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFELTM: GFELTM in GF domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (GFTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFTPTREF: GFTPTREF in GF domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by GFELTM, GFTPTNUM, and GFTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
GF.GFRFTDTC: GFRFTDTC in GF domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by GFTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.STUDYID: STUDYID in IE domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in IE domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.USUBJID: USUBJID in IE domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.IESEQ: IESEQ in IE domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.IESPID: IESPID in IE domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Inclusion or exclusion criteria number from CRF. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.IETESTCD: IETESTCD in IE domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Short Name | Description: Short name of the criterion described in IETEST. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "IN01", "EX01". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.IETEST: IETEST in IE domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion | Description: Verbatim description of the inclusion or exclusion criterion that was the exception for the subject within the study. IETEST cannot be longer than 200 characters. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.IECAT: IECAT in IE domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category | Description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.IESCAT: IESCAT in IE domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory | Description: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or for to categorize as a major or minor exceptions. Examples: "MAJOR", "MINOR". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.IEORRES: IEORRES in IE domain | Label: I/E Criterion Original Result | Description: Original response to inclusion/exclusion criterion question, i.e., whether the inclusion or exclusion criterion was met. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.IESTRESC: IESTRESC in IE domain | Label: I/E Criterion Result in Std Format | Description: Response to inclusion/exclusion criterion result, in standard format. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IE.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in IE domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.VISIT: VISIT in IE domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.VISITDY: VISITDY in IE domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.TAETORD: TAETORD in IE domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.EPOCH: EPOCH in IE domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the inclusion/exclusion finding. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.IEDTC: IEDTC in IE domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of the inclusion/exclusion criterion represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IE.IEDY: IEDY in IE domain | Label: Study Day of Collection | Description: Study day of collection of the inclusion/exclusion exceptions, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.STUDYID: STUDYID in IS domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IS.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in IS domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IS.USUBJID: USUBJID in IS domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IS.NHOID: NHOID in IS domain | Label: Non-host Organism ID | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISSEQ: ISSEQ in IS domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IS.ISGRPID: ISGRPID in IS domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISREFID: ISREFID in IS domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: "458975-01". | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISSPID: ISSPID in IS domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISTESTCD: ISTESTCD in IS domain | Label: Immunogenicity Test/Exam Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in ISTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in ISTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). ISTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IS.ISTEST: ISTEST in IS domain | Label: Immunogenicity Test or Examination Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in ISTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Immunoglobulin E". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
IS.ISTSTCND: ISTSTCND in IS domain | Label: Test Condition | Description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISCNDAGT: ISCNDAGT in IS domain | Label: Test Condition Agent | Description: The textual description of the agent used to impose a test condition. Examples are different stimulating agents used in immunoassays such as those in the Interferon Gamma Response assay (e.g., Mycobacterium tuberculosis ESAT-6, CFP-10, TB 7.7, Mitogen). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISBDAGNT: ISBDAGNT in IS domain | Label: Binding Agent | Description: Text description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the ISTEST variable. ISBDAGNT is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the ISTEST and ISBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n ISBDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the 2 entities in ISTEST and ISBDAGNT. In other words, the combination of ISTEST and ISBDAGNT should describe the entity or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be (but is not limited to) a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, an endogenous molecule, an allergen, or an infectious agent. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISTSTOPO: ISTSTOPO in IS domain | Label: Test Operational Objective | Description: Text description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level. If populated, valid values are "SCREEN", "CONFIRM", and "QUANTIFY". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISMSCBCE: ISMSCBCE in IS domain | Label: Molecule Secreted by Cells | Description: Text description of the entity secreted by the cells represented in ISTEST. The combination of ISTEST and ISMSCBCE should describe the entity or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISTSTDTL: ISTSTDTL in IS domain | Label: Test Detail | Description: Further description of ISTESTCD and ISTEST. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISCAT: ISCAT in IS domain | Label: Category for Immunogenicity Test | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects. Example: "SEROLOGY". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISSCAT: ISSCAT in IS domain | Label: Subcategory for Immunogenicity Test | Description: A further categorization of ISCAT. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISORRES: ISORRES in IS domain | Label: Results or Findings in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISORRESU: ISORRESU in IS domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for ISORRES. Examples: "Index Value", "gpELISA", "unit/mL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISORNRLO: ISORNRLO in IS domain | Label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit | Description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISORNRHI: ISORNRHI in IS domain | Label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit | Description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISSTRESC: ISSTRESC in IS domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from ISORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. ISSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in ISSTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISSTRESN: ISSTRESN in IS domain | Label: Numeric Results/Findings in Std. Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from ISSTRESC. ISSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISSTRESU: ISSTRESU in IS domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for ISSTRESC and ISSTRESN. Examples: "Index Value", "gpELISA", "unit/mL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISSTNRLO: ISSTNRLO in IS domain | Label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units | Description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for ISSTRESC/ISSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISSTNRHI: ISSTNRHI in IS domain | Label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units | Description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISSTNRC: ISSTNRC in IS domain | Label: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units | Description: For normal range values that are character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. Examples: "-1 to +1", "NEGATIVE TO TRACE". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISNRIND: ISNRIND in IS domain | Label: Reference Range Indicator | Description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by ISORNRLO and ISORNRHI, ISSTNRLO and ISSTNRHI, or by ISSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". \n Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether ISNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. \n Should not be used to indicate clinical significance. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISSTAT: ISSTAT in IS domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate a test was not done. Should be null if a result exists in ISORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISREASND: ISREASND in IS domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Used in conjunction with ISSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISNAM: ISNAM in IS domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provided the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISSPEC: ISSPEC in IS domain | Label: Specimen Type | Description: Defines the types of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SERUM". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISSPCCND: ISSPCCND in IS domain | Label: Specimen Condition | Description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISSPCUFL: ISSPCUFL in IS domain | Label: Specimen Usability for the Test | Description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISMETHOD: ISMETHOD in IS domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "ELISA", "ELISPOT". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISLOBXFL: ISLOBXFL in IS domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISBLFL: ISBLFL in IS domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that ISBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISDRVFL: ISDRVFL in IS domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets include those that represent the average of other records, do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected. If ISDRVFL="Y", then ISORRES may be null, with ISSTRESC and (if numeric) ISSTRESN having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISLLOQ: ISLLOQ in IS domain | Label: Lower Limit of Quantitation | Description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for ISSTRESU. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in IS domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.VISIT: VISIT in IS domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.VISITDY: VISITDY in IS domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.TAETORD: TAETORD in IS domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.EPOCH: EPOCH in IS domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISDTC: ISDTC in IS domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of an observation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
IS.ISENDTC: ISENDTC in IS domain | Label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: End date/time of the observation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISDY: ISDY in IS domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISENDY: ISENDY in IS domain | Label: Study Day of End of Specimen Collection | Description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISTPT: ISTPT in IS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See ISTPTNUM and ISTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISTPTNUM: ISTPTNUM in IS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of ISTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISELTM: ISELTM in IS domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (ISTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by ISTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by ISTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISTPTREF: ISTPTREF in IS domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by ISELTM, ISTPTNUM, and ISTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
IS.ISRFTDTC: ISRFTDTC in IS domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point, ISTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.STUDYID: STUDYID in LB domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
LB.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in LB domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
LB.USUBJID: USUBJID in LB domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
LB.LBSEQ: LBSEQ in LB domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
LB.LBGRPID: LBGRPID in LB domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBREFID: LBREFID in LB domain | Label: Specimen ID | Description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: specimen ID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBSPID: LBSPID in LB domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the Lab page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTESTCD: LBTESTCD in LB domain | Label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in LBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in LBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). LBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ALT", "LDH". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
LB.LBTEST: LBTEST in LB domain | Label: Lab Test or Examination Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Note: Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in LBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Alanine Aminotransferase", "Lactate Dehydrogenase". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
LB.LBTSTCND: LBTSTCND in LB domain | Label: Test Condition | Description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBBDAGNT: LBBDAGNT in LB domain | Label: Binding Agent | Description: The textual description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the LBTEST variable. The LBBDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the LBTEST and LBBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n LBBDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the 2 entities in LBTEST and LBBDAGNT. In other words, the combination of LBTEST and LBBDAGNT should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be (but is not limited to) a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, or an endogenous molecule. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTSTOPO: LBTSTOPO in LB domain | Label: Test Operational Objective | Description: Text description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBCAT: LBCAT in LB domain | Label: Category for Lab Test | Description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: "HEMATOLOGY", "URINALYSIS", "CHEMISTRY". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBSCAT: LBSCAT in LB domain | Label: Subcategory for Lab Test | Description: A further categorization of a test category. Examples: "DIFFERENTIAL", "COAGULATION", "LIVER FUNCTION", "ELECTROLYTES". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBORRES: LBORRES in LB domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBORRESU: LBORRESU in LB domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for LBORRES. Example: "g/L". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBRESSCL: LBRESSCL in LB domain | Label: Result Scale | Description: Classifies the scale of the original result value; for example, whether the result is ordinal, nominal, quantitative, or narrative. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBRESTYP: LBRESTYP in LB domain | Label: Result Type | Description: Classifies the kind of result (i.e., property type) originally reported for the test. Examples include substance concentration, proportion, mass rate, and arbitrary concentration. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBCOLSRT: LBCOLSRT in LB domain | Label: Collected Summary Result Type | Description: Used to indicate the type of collected summary result. This includes source summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). If the summary result is derived by the sponsor using individual source data records from SDTM, the derived summary result is represented in ADaM. If the summary result is produced and reported by the lab, the collected summary result is represented in SDTM. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBORNRLO: LBORNRLO in LB domain | Label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit | Description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBORNRHI: LBORNRHI in LB domain | Label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit | Description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBLLOD: LBLLOD in LB domain | Label: Lower Limit of Detection | Description: The lowest threshold (as originally received or collected) for reliably detecting the presence or absence of substance measured by a specific test. The value for the field will be as described in documentation from the instrument or lab vendor. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBSTRESC: LBSTRESC in LB domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units. LBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in LBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in LBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in LBSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see Original and Standardized Results. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBSTRESN: LBSTRESN in LB domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from LBSTRESC. LBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBSTRESU: LBSTRESU in LB domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for LBSTRESC or LBSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBSTNRLO: LBSTNRLO in LB domain | Label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units | Description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for LBSTRESC/LBSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBSTNRHI: LBSTNRHI in LB domain | Label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units | Description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBSTNRC: LBSTNRC in LB domain | Label: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units | Description: For normal range values that are character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. Examples: "-1 to +1", "NEGATIVE TO TRACE". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBNRIND: LBNRIND in LB domain | Label: Reference Range Indicator | Description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI, LBSTNRLO and LBSTNRHI, or by LBSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether LBNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. LBNRIND is not used to indicate clinical significance. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBSTAT: LBSTAT in LB domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate exam not done. Should be null if a result exists in LBORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBREASND: LBREASND in LB domain | Label: Reason Test Not Done | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED", or "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with LBSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBNAM: LBNAM in LB domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: The name or identifier of the laboratory that performed the test. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBLOINC: LBLOINC in LB domain | Label: LOINC Code | Description: Code for the lab test from the LOINC code system. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBSPEC: LBSPEC in LB domain | Label: Specimen Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBSPCCND: LBSPCCND in LB domain | Label: Specimen Condition | Description: The physical state or quality of a sample for an assessment. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBSPCUFL: LBSPCUFL in LB domain | Label: Specimen Usability for the Test | Description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBMETHOD: LBMETHOD in LB domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EIA" (enzyme immunoassay), "ELECTROPHORESIS", "DIPSTICK". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBANMETH: LBANMETH in LB domain | Label: Analysis Method | Description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., a calculation used to measure eGFR). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTMTHSN: LBTMTHSN in LB domain | Label: Test Method Sensitivity | Description: The sensitivity of the test methodology with respect to observation, detection, or quantification. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBLOBXFL: LBLOBXFL in LB domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBBLFL: LBBLFL in LB domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that LBBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBFAST: LBFAST in LB domain | Label: Fasting Status | Description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Examples: "Y", "N". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBDRVFL: LBDRVFL in LB domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If LBDRVFL="Y", then LBORRES may be null, with LBSTRESC and (if numeric) LBSTRESN having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTOX: LBTOX in LB domain | Label: Toxicity | Description: Description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR. The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTOXGR: LBTOXGR in LB domain | Label: Standard Toxicity Grade | Description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., the NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2" not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBCLSIG: LBCLSIG in LB domain | Label: Clinically Significant, Collected | Description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in LB domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.VISIT: VISIT in LB domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.VISITDY: VISITDY in LB domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.TAETORD: TAETORD in LB domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.EPOCH: EPOCH in LB domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBDTC: LBDTC in LB domain | Label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
LB.LBENDTC: LBENDTC in LB domain | Label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: End date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBDY: LBDY in LB domain | Label: Study Day of Specimen Collection | Description: Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBENDY: LBENDY in LB domain | Label: Study Day of End of Observation | Description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTPT: LBTPT in LB domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See LBTPTNUM and LBTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTPTNUM: LBTPTNUM in LB domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of LBTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBELTM: LBELTM in LB domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (LBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBTPTREF: LBTPTREF in LB domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by LBELTM, LBTPTNUM, and LBTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBRFTDTC: LBRFTDTC in LB domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point, LBTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBPTFL: LBPTFL in LB domain | Label: Point in Time Flag | Description: An indication that the specimen was collected at a single point in time. The value is "Y" or null. The intent of this variable in the LB domain is to aid mapping to LOINC codes in the dataset, when LOINC part "Time Aspect" = "Pt". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
LB.LBPDUR: LBPDUR in LB domain | Label: Planned Duration | Description: Planned duration of specimen collection. If LBPTFL is "Y" then LBPDUR is null. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.STUDYID: STUDYID in MB domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MB.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in MB domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MB.USUBJID: USUBJID in MB domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MB.FOCID: FOCID in MB domain | Label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest | Description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSEQ: MBSEQ in MB domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MB.MBGRPID: MBGRPID in MB domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBREFID: MBREFID in MB domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external specimen identifier (e.g., sample ID for a subject sample from which a microbial culture was generated). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSPID: MBSPID in MB domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBLNKID: MBLNKID in MB domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, it may be used to link genetic findings (in the PF domain) about a microbe to the original culture of that microbe (in MB), or to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBLNKGRP: MBLNKGRP in MB domain | Label: Link Group ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBTESTCD: MBTESTCD in MB domain | Label: Microbiology Test or Finding Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or finding described in MBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MCORGIDN" for Microbial Organism Identification "GMNCOC" for Gram Negative Cocci. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MB.MBTEST: MBTEST in MB domain | Label: Microbiology Test or Finding Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Microbial Organism Identification", "Gram Negative Cocci", "HIV-1 RNA". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MB.MBTSTDTL: MBTSTDTL in MB domain | Label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail | Description: Further description of MBTESTCD and MBTEST. Example: "VIRAL LOAD" when MBTESTCD represents viral genetic material, such as "HCRNA", "QUANTIFICATION" when MBTESTCD represents any organism being quantified. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBCAT: MBCAT in MB domain | Label: Category | Description: Used to define a category of related records. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSCAT: MBSCAT in MB domain | Label: Subcategory | Description: Used to define a further categorization of MBCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBORRES: MBORRES in MB domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the microbiology measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples for "GRAM STAIN" findings: "+3 MODERATE", "+2 FEW", "<10". Examples for "CULTURE PLATE" findings: "KLEBSIELLA PNEUMONIAE", "STREPTOCOCCUS PNEUMONIAE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MB.MBORRESU: MBORRESU in MB domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original unit for MBORRES. Example: "mcg/mL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSTRESC: MBSTRESC in MB domain | Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from MBORRES, in a standard format or standard units. MBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "+3 MODERATE", "MOD", and "MODERATE" in MBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MBSTRESC as "MODERATE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MB.MBSTRESN: MBSTRESN in MB domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MBSTRESC. MBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSTRESU: MBSTRESU in MB domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for MBSTRESC and MBSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBRESCAT: MBRESCAT in MB domain | Label: Result Category | Description: Used to categorize the result of a finding in a standard format. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSTAT: MBSTAT in MB domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or that a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBREASND: MBREASND in MB domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MBSTAT when value is NOT DONE. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBNAM: MBNAM in MB domain | Label: Laboratory/Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBLOINC: MBLOINC in MB domain | Label: LOINC Code | Description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable (e.g., lab test). | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSPEC: MBSPEC in MB domain | Label: Specimen Material Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SPUTUM", "BLOOD", "PUS". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBSPCCND: MBSPCCND in MB domain | Label: Specimen Condition | Description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Example: "CONTAMINATED". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBLOC: MBLOC in MB domain | Label: Specimen Collection Location | Description: Anatomical location relevant to the collection of the measurement. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBLAT: MBLAT in MB domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for specimen collection location further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBDIR: MBDIR in MB domain | Label: Directionality | Description: Qualifier for specimen collection location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBMETHOD: MBMETHOD in MB domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "GRAM STAIN", "MICROBIAL CULTURE, LIQUID", "QUANTITATIVE REVERSE TRANSCRIPTASE POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MB.MBLOBXFL: MBLOBXFL in MB domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBBLFL: MBBLFL in MB domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MBBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBFAST: MBFAST in MB domain | Label: Fasting Status | Description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBDRVFL: MBDRVFL in MB domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in MB domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MB.VISIT: VISIT in MB domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.VISITDY: VISITDY in MB domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.TAETORD: TAETORD in MB domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element which the specimen collection occurred. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.EPOCH: EPOCH in MB domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBDTC: MBDTC in MB domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Date/time of specimen collection. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings

MB.MBTPT: MBTPT in MB domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See MBTPTNUM and MBTPTREF. MB.MBTPTNUM: MBTPTNUM in MB domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of MBTPT used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBELTM: MBELTM in MB domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (MBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBTPTREF: MBTPTREF in MB domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by MBELTM, MBTPTNUM, and MBTPT. Example: "PREVIOUS DOSE". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MB.MBRFTDTC: MBRFTDTC in MB domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point, MBTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings

MI.USUBJID: USUBJID in MI domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MI.MISEQ: MISEQ in MI domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MI.MIGRPID: MIGRPID in MI domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. This is not the treatment group number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MIREFID: MIREFID in MI domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: specimen barcode number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MISPID: MISPID in MI domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. MI.MITESTCD: MITESTCD in MI domain | Label: Microscopic Examination Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in MITEST. Examples: "HER2", "BRCA1", "TTF1". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
MI.MITEST: MITEST in MI domain | Label: Microscopic Examination Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Examples: "Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2", "Breast Cancer Susceptibility Gene 1", "Thyroid Transcription Factor 1". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings

MI.MICAT: MICAT in MI domain | Label: Category for Microscopic Finding | Description: Used to define a category of related records. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MISCAT: MISCAT in MI domain | Label: Subcategory for Microscopic Finding | Description: Used to define a further categorization of MICAT. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MIORRES: MIORRES in MI domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the histopathology measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings

MI.MISTRESC: MISTRESC in MI domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MIORRES in a standard format or standard units. MI.MISTRESN: MISTRESN in MI domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MISTRESC. MI.MISTRESU: MISTRESU in MI domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for MISTRESC and MISTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings

MI.MILOC: MILOC in MI domain | Label: Specimen Collection Location | Description: Location relevant to the collection of the specimen. Examples: "LUNG", "KNEE JOINT", "ARM", "THIGH". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MILAT: MILAT in MI domain | Label: Specimen Laterality within Subject | Description: Qualifier for laterality of the location of the specimen in MILOC. Examples: "LEFT", "RIGHT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MIDIR: MIDIR in MI domain | Label: Specimen Directionality within Subject | Description: Qualifier for directionality of the location of the specimen in MILOC. Examples: "DORSAL", "PROXIMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MIMETHOD: MIMETHOD in MI domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. This could include the technique or type of staining used for the slides. MI.MILOBXFL: MILOBXFL in MI domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MI.MIBLFL: MIBLFL in MI domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. MI.MIEVAL: MIEVAL in MI domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Example: "PATHOLOGIST", "PEER REVIEW", "SPONSOR PATHOLOGIST". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in MI domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MI.VISIT: VISIT in MI domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
