MI.TAETORD: TAETORD in MI domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.EPOCH: EPOCH in MI domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MI.MIDTC: MIDTC in MI domain | Label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: Date/time of specimen collection, in ISO 8601 format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MI.MIDY: MIDY in MI domain | Label: Study Day of Specimen Collection | Description: Study day of specimen collection, in integer days. MK.MKSTAT: MKSTAT in MK domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or that a test was attempted but did not generate a result. MS.MSSTRESC: MSSTRESC in MS domain | Label: Result or Finding in Standard Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MSORRES in a standard format or in standard units. MSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MSSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in MSORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MS.MSSTRESN: MSSTRESN in MS domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MSSTRESC. MSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSSTRESU: MSSTRESU in MS domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for MSSTRESC and MSSTRESN. Example: "mol/L". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSNRIND: MSNRIND in MS domain | Label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator | Description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by MSORNRLO and MSORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N", "HIGH", "LOW", "NORMAL". "ABNORMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSRESCAT: MSRESCAT in MS domain | Label: Result Category | Description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. In SDTMIG v3.2, MSRESCAT was used to categorize a numeric susceptibility result represented in MSORRES as either "SUSCEPTIBLE", "INTERMEDIATE", or "RESISTANT". However, results from some susceptibility tests may report only a categorical result and not a numeric result. Thus, in order for susceptibility results to be represented consistently, MSRESCAT should no longer be used for this purpose. In this version, the core designation has been changed from Expected to Permissible. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSSTAT: MSSTAT in MS domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSREASND: MSREASND in MS domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSXFN: MSXFN in MS domain | Label: External File Path | Description: Filename for an external file. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSNAM: MSNAM in MS domain | Label: Laboratory/Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSLOINC: MSLOINC in MS domain | Label: LOINC Code | Description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable such as a lab test. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSSPEC: MSSPEC in MS domain | Label: Specimen Material Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SPUTUM". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSSPCCND: MSSPCCND in MS domain | Label: Specimen Condition | Description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Example: "CLOUDY". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSLOC: MSLOC in MS domain | Label: Location Used for the Measurement | Description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSLAT: MSLAT in MS domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSDIR: MSDIR in MS domain | Label: Directionality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSMETHOD: MSMETHOD in MS domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EPSILOMETER", "MACRO BROTH DILUTION". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSANMETH: MSANMETH in MS domain | Label: Analysis Method | Description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., an image or a genetic sequence). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSLOBXFL: MSLOBXFL in MS domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSBLFL: MSBLFL in MS domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSFAST: MSFAST in MS domain | Label: Fasting Status | Description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSDRVFL: MSDRVFL in MS domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSEVAL: MSEVAL in MS domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "MICROSCOPIST". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSEVALID: MSEVALID in MS domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in MSEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSACPTFL: MSACPTFL in MS domain | Label: Accepted Record Flag | Description: In cases where more than 1 assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSLLOQ: MSLLOQ in MS domain | Label: Lower Limit of Quantitation | Description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for MSSTRESU. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSULOQ: MSULOQ in MS domain | Label: Upper Limit of Quantitation | Description: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for MSSTRESU. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSREPNUM: MSREPNUM in MS domain | Label: Repetition Number | Description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in MS domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
MS.VISIT: VISIT in MS domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.VISITDY: VISITDY in MS domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.TAETORD: TAETORD in MS domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the specimen was collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.EPOCH: EPOCH in MS domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSDTC: MSDTC in MS domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of an observation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSDY: MSDY in MS domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSDUR: MSDUR in MS domain | Label: Duration | Description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSTPT: MSTPT in MS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See MSTPTNUM and MSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSTPTNUM: MSTPTNUM in MS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSELTM: MSELTM in MS domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (MSTPTREF; e.g., previous dose, previous meal). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSTPTREF: MSTPTREF in MS domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by MSELTM, MSTPTNUM, and MSTPT. Example: "PREVIOUS DOSE". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSRFTDTC: MSRFTDTC in MS domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by MSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSEVLINT: MSEVLINT in MS domain | Label: Evaluation Interval | Description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding MSTESTCD. Example: "-P2M" to represent a period of the past 2 months before the assessment. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
MS.MSEVINTX: MSEVINTX in MS domain | Label: Evaluation Interval Text | Description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.STUDYID: STUDYID in NV domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
NV.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in NV domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
NV.USUBJID: USUBJID in NV domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
NV.FOCID: FOCID in NV domain | Label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest | Description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1") or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back"). The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVSEQ: NVSEQ in NV domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
NV.NVGRPID: NVGRPID in NV domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVREFID: NVREFID in NV domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external procedure identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVSPID: NVSPID in NV domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the Procedure or Test page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVLNKID: NVLNKID in NV domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link a procedure to the assessment results over the course of the study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVLNKGRP: NVLNKGRP in NV domain | Label: Link Group | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVTESTCD: NVTESTCD in NV domain | Label: Short Name of Nervous System Test | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in NVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in NVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). NVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SUVR", "N75LAT", "P100LAT","N145LAT". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
NV.NVTEST: NVTEST in NV domain | Label: Name of Nervous System Test | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in NVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Standard Uptake Value Ratio", "N75 Latency", "P100 Latency", "N145 Latency". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
NV.NVCAT: NVCAT in NV domain | Label: Category for Nervous System Test | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "VISUAL EVOKED POTENTIAL". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVSCAT: NVSCAT in NV domain | Label: Subcategory for Nervous System Test | Description: Used to define a further categorization of NVCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVORRES: NVORRES in NV domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the procedure measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
NV.NVORRESU: NVORRESU in NV domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for NVORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVSTRESC: NVSTRESC in NV domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from NVORRES, in a standard format or standard units. NVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in NVSTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
NV.NVSTRESN: NVSTRESN in NV domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from NVSTRESC. NVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVSTRESU: NVSTRESU in NV domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for NVSTRESC or NVSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVSTAT: NVSTAT in NV domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate a test was not done, or a measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in NVORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVREASND: NVREASND in NV domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with NVSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVLOC: NVLOC in NV domain | Label: Location Used for the Measurement | Description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "BRAIN", "EYE", "PRECUNEUS", "CINGULATE CORTEX". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVLAT: NVLAT in NV domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVDIR: NVDIR in NV domain | Label: Directionality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVMETHOD: NVMETHOD in NV domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EEG", "PET/CT SCAN ", "FDGPET". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVLOBXFL: NVLOBXFL in NV domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVBLFL: NVBLFL in NV domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that NVBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVDRVFL: NVDRVFL in NV domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVEVAL: NVEVAL in NV domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVEVALID: NVEVALID in NV domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in NVEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in NV domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
NV.VISIT: VISIT in NV domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.VISITDY: VISITDY in NV domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.TAETORD: TAETORD in NV domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.EPOCH: EPOCH in NV domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVDTC: NVDTC in NV domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Date of procedure or test. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
NV.NVDY: NVDY in NV domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Study day of the procedure or test, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVTPT: NVTPT in NV domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See NVTPTNUM and NVTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVTPTNUM: NVTPTNUM in NV domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of NVTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVELTM: NVELTM in NV domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (NVTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVTPTREF: NVTPTREF in NV domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by NVELTM, NVTPTNUM, and NVTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
NV.NVRFTDTC: NVRFTDTC in NV domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.STUDYID: STUDYID in OE domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
OE.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in OE domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
OE.USUBJID: USUBJID in OE domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
OE.FOCID: FOCID in OE domain | Label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest | Description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OESEQ: OESEQ in OE domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
OE.OEGRPID: OEGRPID in OE domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OELNKID: OELNKID in OE domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OELNKGRP: OELNKGRP in OE domain | Label: Link Group | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OETESTCD: OETESTCD in OE domain | Label: Short Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam | Description: Short character value for OETEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in OETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). OETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "NUMLCOR". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
OE.OETEST: OETEST in OE domain | Label: Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam | Description: Long name for the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in OETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Number of Letters Correct" for OETESTCD = "NUMLCOR". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
OE.OETSTDTL: OETSTDTL in OE domain | Label: Ophthalmic Test or Exam Detail | Description: Further description of OETESTCD and OETEST. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OECAT: OECAT in OE domain | Label: Category for Ophthalmic Test or Exam | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "VISUAL ACUITY", "CONTRAST SENSITIVITY", "OCULAR COMFORT". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OESCAT: OESCAT in OE domain | Label: Subcategory for Ophthalmic Test or Exam | Description: Used to define a further categorization of OECAT values. Example: "HIGH CONTRAST" or "LOW CONTRAST" when OECAT is "VISUAL ACUITY". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEORRES: OEORRES in OE domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: "120", "<1, NORMAL", "RED SPOT VISIBLE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OEORRESU: OEORRESU in OE domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original unit for OEORRES. Examples: "mm", "um". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OEORNRLO: OEORNRLO in OE domain | Label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units | Description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for results stored in OEORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEORNRHI: OEORNRHI in OE domain | Label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units | Description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for results stored in OEORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OESTRESC: OESTRESC in OE domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from OEORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. OESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in OESTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OESTRESN: OESTRESN in OE domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from OESTRESC. OESTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OESTRESU: OESTRESU in OE domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for OESTRESC and OESTRESN. Examples: "mm", "um". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OESTNRLO: OESTNRLO in OE domain | Label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Standard Units | Description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., OESTRESC, OESTRESN) represented in standardized units (OESTRESU). | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OESTNRHI: OESTNRHI in OE domain | Label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units | Description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., OESTRESC, OESTRESN) represented in standardized units (OESTRESU). | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OESTNRC: OESTNRC in OE domain | Label: Normal Range for Character Results | Description: Normal range or reference range for results stored in OESTRESC that are character in ordinal or categorical scale. Example: "Negative to Trace". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OENRIND: OENRIND in OE domain | Label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator | Description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by OEORNRLO and OEORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N"; "HIGH", "LOW"; "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OERESCAT: OERESCAT in OE domain | Label: Result Category | Description: Used to categorize the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results. Examples: "POSITIVE", "NEGATIVE". The variable OERESCAT is not meant to replace the use of OENRIND for cases where normal ranges are provided. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OESTAT: OESTAT in OE domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEREASND: OEREASND in OE domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with OESTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEXFN: OEXFN in OE domain | Label: External File Path | Description: Filename for an external file, such as one for a retinal OCT image. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OELOC: OELOC in OE domain | Label: Location Used for the Measurement | Description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "EYE" for a finding record relative to the complete eye, "RETINA" for a measurement or assessment of only the retina. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OELAT: OELAT in OE domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OEDIR: OEDIR in OE domain | Label: Directionality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEPORTOT: OEPORTOT in OE domain | Label: Portion or Totality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of). Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT", "MANY". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEMETHOD: OEMETHOD in OE domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Example: "ETDRS EYE CHART" for OETESTCD = "NUMLCOR". The different methods may offer different functionality or granularity, affecting the set of results and associated meaning. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OELOBXFL: OELOBXFL in OE domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OEBLFL: OEBLFL in OE domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that OEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEDRVFL: OEDRVFL in OE domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEEVAL: OEEVAL in OE domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "INVESTIGATOR". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEEVALID: OEEVALID in OE domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in OEEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEACPTFL: OEACPTFL in OE domain | Label: Accepted Record Flag | Description: In cases where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEREPNUM: OEREPNUM in OE domain | Label: Repetition Number | Description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in OE domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.VISIT: VISIT in OE domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.VISITDY: VISITDY in OE domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.TAETORD: TAETORD in OE domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.EPOCH: EPOCH in OE domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEDTC: OEDTC in OE domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date/time of the observation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OEDY: OEDY in OE domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of observation/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
OE.OETPT: OETPT in OE domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OETPTNUM: OETPTNUM in OE domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OEELTM: OEELTM in OE domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (OETPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OETPTREF: OETPTREF in OE domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by OETPT, OETPTNUM, and OEELTM. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
OE.OERFTDTC: OERFTDTC in OE domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point, OETPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.STUDYID: STUDYID in PC domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PC.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in PC domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PC.USUBJID: USUBJID in PC domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PC.PCSEQ: PCSEQ in PC domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PC.PCGRPID: PCGRPID in PC domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCREFID: PCREFID in PC domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external specimen identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCSPID: PCSPID in PC domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCTESTCD: PCTESTCD in PC domain | Label: Pharmacokinetic Test Short Name | Description: Short name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ASA", "VOL", "SPG". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PC.PCTEST: PCTEST in PC domain | Label: Pharmacokinetic Test Name | Description: Name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. Note any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in PCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Acetylsalicylic Acid", "Volume", "Specific Gravity". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PC.PCCAT: PCCAT in PC domain | Label: Test Category | Description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "ANALYTE", "SPECIMEN PROPERTY". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCSCAT: PCSCAT in PC domain | Label: Test Subcategory | Description: A further categorization of a test category. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCORRES: PCORRES in PC domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCORRESU: PCORRESU in PC domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PCORRES. Example: "mg/L". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCSTRESC: PCSTRESC in PC domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PCORRES in a standard format or standard units. PCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in PCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in PCORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in PCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCSTRESN: PCSTRESN in PC domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from PCSTRESC. PCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCSTRESU: PCSTRESU in PC domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for PCSTRESC and PCSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCSTAT: PCSTAT in PC domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate a result was not obtained. Should be null if a result exists in PCORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCREASND: PCREASND in PC domain | Label: Reason Test Not Done | Description: Describes why a result was not obtained, such as "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with PCSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCNAM: PCNAM in PC domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provides the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCSPEC: PCSPEC in PC domain | Label: Specimen Material Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCSPCCND: PCSPCCND in PC domain | Label: Specimen Condition | Description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCMETHOD: PCMETHOD in PC domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "HPLC/MS", "ELISA". This should contain sufficient information and granularity to allow differentiation of various methods that might have been used within a study. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCFAST: PCFAST in PC domain | Label: Fasting Status | Description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCDRVFL: PCDRVFL in PC domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, which do not come from the CRF, are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If PCDRVFL = "Y", then PCORRES may be null with PCSTRESC, and PCSTRESN (if the result is numeric) having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCLLOQ: PCLLOQ in PC domain | Label: Lower Limit of Quantitation | Description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCULOQ: PCULOQ in PC domain | Label: Upper Limit of Quantitation | Description: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in PC domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.VISIT: VISIT in PC domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.VISITDY: VISITDY in PC domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.TAETORD: TAETORD in PC domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.EPOCH: EPOCH in PC domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCDTC: PCDTC in PC domain | Label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, then this will be the collection time. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PC.PCENDTC: PCENDTC in PC domain | Label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection | Description: End date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, the collection time should be stored in PCDTC, and PCENDTC should be null. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCDY: PCDY in PC domain | Label: Actual Study Day of Specimen Collection | Description: Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCENDY: PCENDY in PC domain | Label: Study Day of End of Observation | Description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCTPT: PCTPT in PC domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PCTPTNUM and PCTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCTPTNUM: PCTPTNUM in PC domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of PCTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCELTM: PCELTM in PC domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (PCTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCTPTREF: PCTPTREF in PC domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point used as a basis for PCTPT, PCTPTNUM, and PCELTM. Example: "MOST RECENT DOSE". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCRFTDTC: PCRFTDTC in PC domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point described by PCTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PC.PCEVLINT: PCEVLINT in PC domain | Label: Evaluation Interval | Description: Evaluation Interval associated with a PCTEST record represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-PT2H" to represent an evaluation interval of 2 hours prior to a PCTPT. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.STUDYID: STUDYID in PE domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PE.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in PE domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PE.USUBJID: USUBJID in PE domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PE.PESEQ: PESEQ in PE domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PE.PEGRPID: PEGRPID in PE domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to link together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PESPID: PESPID in PE domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PETESTCD: PETESTCD in PE domain | Label: Body System Examined Short Name | Description: Short name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "HEAD", "ENT". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "PHYSEXAM". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PE.PETEST: PETEST in PE domain | Label: Body System Examined | Description: Long name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. The value in PETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Head", "Ear/Nose/Throat". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "Physical Examination". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PE.PEMODIFY: PEMODIFY in PE domain | Label: Modified Reported Term | Description: If the value of PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PECAT: PECAT in PE domain | Label: Category for Examination | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "GENERAL". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PESCAT: PESCAT in PE domain | Label: Subcategory for Examination | Description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PEBODSYS: PEBODSYS in PE domain | Label: Body System or Organ Class | Description: Body system or organ class (e.g., MedDRA SOC) that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PEORRES: PEORRES in PE domain | Label: Verbatim Examination Finding | Description: Text description of any abnormal findings. If the examination was completed and there were no abnormal findings, the value should be "NORMAL". If the examination was not performed on a particular body system, or at the subject level, then the value should be null, and "NOT DONE" should appear in PESTAT. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PE.PEORRESU: PEORRESU in PE domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PEORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PESTRESC: PESTRESC in PE domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: If there are findings for a body system, then either the dictionary preferred term (if findings are coded using a dictionary) or PEORRES (if findings are not encoded) should appear here. If PEORRES is null, PESTRESC must be null. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PE.PESTAT: PESTAT in PE domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate exam not done. Must be null if a result exists in PEORRES/PESTRESC. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PEREASND: PEREASND in PE domain | Label: Reason Not Examined | Description: Describes why an examination was not performed or why a body system was not examined. Example: "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with PESTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PELOC: PELOC in PE domain | Label: Location of Physical Exam Finding | Description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Example: "ARM" for skin rash. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PELAT: PELAT in PE domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterallity. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PEMETHOD: PEMETHOD in PE domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "PALPATION", "PERCUSSION". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PELOBXFL: PELOBXFL in PE domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PEBLFL: PEBLFL in PE domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as PELOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that PEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PEEVAL: PEEVAL in PE domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Example: "INVESTIGATOR". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in PE domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PE.VISIT: VISIT in PE domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.VISITDY: VISITDY in PE domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.TAETORD: TAETORD in PE domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.EPOCH: EPOCH in PE domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the physical exam finding. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PE.PEDTC: PEDTC in PE domain | Label: Date/Time of Examination | Description: Date and time of the physical examination represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PE.PEDY: PEDY in PE domain | Label: Study Day of Examination | Description: Study day of physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.STUDYID: STUDYID in PP domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PP.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in PP domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PP.USUBJID: USUBJID in PP domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. \n | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PP.PPSEQ: PPSEQ in PP domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PP.PPGRPID: PPGRPID in PP domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPTESTCD: PPTESTCD in PP domain | Label: Parameter Short Name | Description: Short name of the pharmacokinetic parameter. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PPTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PPTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "AUCALL", "TMAX", "CMAX". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PP.PPTEST: PPTEST in PP domain | Label: Parameter Name | Description: Name of the pharmacokinetic parameter. The value in PPTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "AUC All", "Time of CMAX", "Max Conc". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
PP.PPCAT: PPCAT in PP domain | Label: Parameter Category | Description: Used to define a category of related records. For PP, this should be the name of the analyte in PCTEST whose profile the parameter is associated with. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPSCAT: PPSCAT in PP domain | Label: Parameter Subcategory | Description: Categorization of the model type used to calculate the PK parameters. Examples: "COMPARTMENTAL", "NON-COMPARTMENTAL". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPORRES: PPORRES in PP domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPORRESU: PPORRESU in PP domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PPORRES. Example: "ng/L". See PP Assumption 3. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPSTRESC: PPSTRESC in PP domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PPORRES in a standard format or standard units. PPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in PPSTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPSTRESN: PPSTRESN in PP domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from PPSTRESC. PPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPSTRESU: PPSTRESU in PP domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for PPSTRESC and PPSTRESN. See PP Assumption 3. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPSTAT: PPSTAT in PP domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a parameter was not calculated. Should be null if a result exists in PPORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPREASND: PPREASND in PP domain | Label: Reason Parameter Not Calculated | Description: Describes why a parameter was not calculated, such as "INSUFFICIENT DATA". Used in conjunction with PPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPSPEC: PPSPEC in PP domain | Label: Specimen Material Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. If multiple specimen types are used for a calculation (e.g., serum and urine for renal clearance), then this field should be left blank. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPANMETH: PPANMETH in PP domain | Label: Analysis Method | Description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result. Example: A named formula used to calculate AUC, such as "LIN-LOG TRAPEZOIDAL METHOD". \n Sponsor-defined formulas can also be represented by this variable. Example: Calculating ratio AUCs where the PPANMETH may be "DRUG METABOLITE 1 TO DRUG PARENT" or "DRUG METABOLITE 2 TO METABOLITE 1". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.TAETORD: TAETORD in PP domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.EPOCH: EPOCH in PP domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPDTC: PPDTC in PP domain | Label: Date/Time of Parameter Calculations | Description: Nominal date/time of parameter calculations. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPDY: PPDY in PP domain | Label: Study Day of Parameter Calculations | Description: Study day of the collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPTPTREF: PPTPTREF in PP domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: The description of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPRFTDTC: PPRFTDTC in PP domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point from the PC records used to calculate a parameter record. The values in PPRFTDTC should be the same as that in PCRFTDTC for related records. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
PP.PPSTINT: PPSTINT in PP domain | Label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval | Description: The start of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the time point reference. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
PP.PPENINT: PPENINT in PP domain | Label: Planned End of Assessment Interval | Description: The end of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the time point reference. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.STUDYID: STUDYID in QS domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
QS.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in QS domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
QS.USUBJID: USUBJID in QS domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
QS.QSSEQ: QSSEQ in QS domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
QS.QSGRPID: QSGRPID in QS domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSSPID: QSSPID in QS domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Question number on a questionnaire. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSTESTCD: QSTESTCD in QS domain | Label: Question Short Name | Description: Topic variable for QS. Short name for the value in QSTEST, which can be used as a column name when converting the dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in QSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). QSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. \n Controlled terminology for QSTESTCD is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for QSTESTCD. Examples: "ADCCMD01", "BPR0103". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
QS.QSTEST: QSTEST in QS domain | Label: Question Name | Description: Verbatim name of the question or group of questions used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in QSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n Controlled terminology for QSTEST is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for QSTEST. Example: "BPR01 - Emotional Withdrawal". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
QS.QSCAT: QSCAT in QS domain | Label: Category of Question | Description: Used to specify the questionnaire in which the question identified by QSTEST and QSTESTCD was included. Examples: "ADAS-COG", "MDS-UPDRS". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
QS.QSSCAT: QSSCAT in QS domain | Label: Subcategory for Question | Description: A further categorization of the questions within the category. Examples: "MENTAL HEALTH" , "DEPRESSION", "WORD RECALL". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSORRES: QSORRES in QS domain | Label: Finding in Original Units | Description: Finding as originally received or collected (e.g., "RARELY", "SOMETIMES"). When sponsors apply codelist to indicate that code values are statistically meaningful standardized scores (which are defined by sponsors or by valid methodologies, e.g., SF36 questionnaires), QSORRES will contain the decode format; QSSTRESC and QSSTRESN may contain the standardized code values or scores. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
QS.QSORRESU: QSORRESU in QS domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for QSORRES, such as minutes or seconds or the units associated with a visual analog scale. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSSTRESC: QSSTRESC in QS domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the finding for all questions or subscores copied or derived from QSORRES, in a standard format or standard units. QSSTRESC should store all findings in character format; if findings are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in QSSTRESN. If question scores are derived from the original finding, then the standard format is the score. Examples: "0", "1". \n When sponsors apply codelist to indicate the code values are statistically meaningful standardized scores (which are defined by sponsors or by valid methodologies, e.g., SF36 questionnaires), QSORRES will contain the decode format; QSSTRESC and QSSTRESN may contain the standardized code values or scores. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
QS.QSSTRESN: QSSTRESN in QS domain | Label: Numeric Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from QSSTRESC. QSSTRESN should store all numeric results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSSTRESU: QSSTRESU in QS domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for QSSTRESC or QSSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSSTAT: QSSTAT in QS domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not done or was not answered. Should be null if a result exists in QSORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSREASND: QSREASND in QS domain | Label: Reason Not Performed | Description: Describes why a question was not answered. Used in conjunction with QSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". Example: "SUBJECT REFUSED". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSMETHOD: QSMETHOD in QS domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSLOBXFL: QSLOBXFL in QS domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
QS.QSBLFL: QSBLFL in QS domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that QSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSDRVFL: QSDRVFL in QS domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records or questionnaire subscores that do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If QSDRVFL = "Y", then QSORRES may be null with QSSTRESC and (if numeric) QSSTRESN having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in QS domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
QS.VISIT: VISIT in QS domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.VISITDY: VISITDY in QS domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.TAETORD: TAETORD in QS domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.EPOCH: EPOCH in QS domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the physical exam finding. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSDTC: QSDTC in QS domain | Label: Date/Time of Finding | Description: Date of questionnaire. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
QS.QSDY: QSDY in QS domain | Label: Study Day of Finding | Description: Study day of finding collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSTPT: QSTPT in QS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when questionnaire should be administered. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See QSTPTNUM and QSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSTPTNUM: QSTPTNUM in QS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of QSTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSELTM: QSELTM in QS domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (QSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by QSTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by QSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSTPTREF: QSTPTREF in QS domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by QSELTM, QSTPTNUM, and QSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSRFTDTC: QSRFTDTC in QS domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point, QSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSEVLINT: QSEVLINT in QS domain | Label: Evaluation Interval | Description: Evaluation interval associated with a QSTEST question represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2Y" to represent an interval of 2 years in the question "Have you experienced any episodes in the past 2 years?". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
QS.QSEVINTX: QSEVINTX in QS domain | Label: Evaluation Interval Text | Description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.STUDYID: STUDYID in RE domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RE.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in RE domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RE.USUBJID: USUBJID in RE domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RE.SPDEVID: SPDEVID in RE domain | Label: Sponsor Device Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESEQ: RESEQ in RE domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RE.REGRPID: REGRPID in RE domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REREFID: REREFID in RE domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Optional internal or external procedure identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESPID: RESPID in RE domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RELNKID: RELNKID in RE domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RELNKGRP: RELNKGRP in RE domain | Label: Link Group | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RETESTCD: RETESTCD in RE domain | Label: Short Name of Respiratory Test | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination.
