It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in RETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "FEV1", "FVC". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RE.RETEST: RETEST in RE domain | Label: Name of Respiratory Test | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in RETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second", "Forced Vital Capacity". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RE.RECAT: RECAT in RE domain | Label: Category for Respiratory Test | Description: Used to categorize observations across subjects. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESCAT: RESCAT in RE domain | Label: Subcategory for Respiratory Test | Description: A further categorization. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REPOS: REPOS in RE domain | Label: Position of Subject During Observation | Description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REORRES: REORRES in RE domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the procedure measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RE.REORRESU: REORRESU in RE domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for REORRES and REORREF. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REORREF: REORREF in RE domain | Label: Reference Result in Original Units | Description: Reference result for continuous measurements in original units. Should be collected only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESTRESC: RESTRESC in RE domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from REORRES in a standard format or in standard units. RESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RESTRESN. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RE.RESTRESN: RESTRESN in RE domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from RESTRESC. RESTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESTRESU: RESTRESU in RE domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for RESTRESC, RESTRESN and RESTREFN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESTREFC: RESTREFC in RE domain | Label: Character Reference Result | Description: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from --ORREF in a standard format. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESTREFN: RESTREFN in RE domain | Label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units | Description: Reference result for continuous measurements in standard units. Should be populated only for continuous results. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RESTAT: RESTAT in RE domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a test was not done or a measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in REORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REREASND: REREASND in RE domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with RESTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RELOC: RELOC in RE domain | Label: Location Used for the Measurement | Description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "LUNG", "BRONCHUS". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RELAT: RELAT in RE domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Side of the body used to collect measurement. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REDIR: REDIR in RE domain | Label: Directionality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REMETHOD: REMETHOD in RE domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method used to create the result. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RELOBXFL: RELOBXFL in RE domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RE.REBLFL: REBLFL in RE domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be Y or null. Note that REBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REDRVFL: REDRVFL in RE domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. Should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If REDRVFL = "Y", then REORRES could be null, with RESTRESC and (if numeric) RESTRESN having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REEVAL: REEVAL in RE domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REEVALID: REEVALID in RE domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in REEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REREPNUM: REREPNUM in RE domain | Label: Repetition Number | Description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given time frame for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Example: multiple measurements of pulmonary function. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in RE domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RE.VISIT: VISIT in RE domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.VISITDY: VISITDY in RE domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.TAETORD: TAETORD in RE domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.EPOCH: EPOCH in RE domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REDTC: REDTC in RE domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Date/time of procedure or test. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RE.REDY: REDY in RE domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RETPT: RETPT in RE domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See RETPTNUM and RETPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MINUTES POST". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RETPTNUM: RETPTNUM in RE domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of RETPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.REELTM: REELTM in RE domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (RETPTREF). Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent 15 minutes prior to the reference time point indicated by RETPTREF, "PT8H" to represent 8 hours after the reference time point represented by RETPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RETPTREF: RETPTREF in RE domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by REELTM, RETPTNUM, and RETPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RE.RERFTDTC: RERFTDTC in RE domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RETPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.STUDYID: STUDYID in RP domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RP.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in RP domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RP.USUBJID: USUBJID in RP domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RP.RPSEQ: RPSEQ in RP domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RP.RPGRPID: RPGRPID in RP domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPREFID: RPREFID in RP domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPSPID: RPSPID in RP domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: Preprinted line identifier on a CRF. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPLNKID: RPLNKID in RP domain | Label: Link ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPLNKGRP: RPLNKGRP in RP domain | Label: Link Group ID | Description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPTESTCD: RPTESTCD in RP domain | Label: Short Name of Reproductive Test | Description: Short character value for RPTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: "CHILDPOT", "BCMETHOD", "MENARAGE". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RP.RPTEST: RPTEST in RP domain | Label: Name of Reproductive Test | Description: Long name For RPTESTCD. Examples: "Childbearing Potential", "Birth Control Method", "Menarche Age". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RP.RPCAT: RPCAT in RP domain | Label: Category for Reproductive Test | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "No use case to date, but values would be relative to reproduction tests grouping". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPSCAT: RPSCAT in RP domain | Label: Subcategory for Reproductive Test | Description: Used to define a further categorization of RPCAT values. Example: "No use case to date, but values would be relative to reproduction tests grouping". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPORRES: RPORRES in RP domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: "120", "<1", "POS". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RP.RPORRESU: RPORRESU in RP domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Unit for RPORRES. Examples: "in", "LB", "kg/L". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPSTRESC: RPSTRESC in RP domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from RPORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. RPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RPSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in RPORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in RPSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RP.RPSTRESN: RPSTRESN in RP domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from RPSTRESC. RPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPSTRESU: RPSTRESU in RP domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for RPSTRESC and RPSTRESN. Example: "mol/L". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPSTAT: RPSTAT in RP domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPREASND: RPREASND in RP domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with RPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPLOBXFL: RPLOBXFL in RP domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPBLFL: RPBLFL in RP domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that RPBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPDRVFL: RPDRVFL in RP domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records which represent the average of other records or which do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If RPDRVFL = "Y", then RPORRES may be null, with RPSTRESC and (if numeric) RPSTRESN having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in RP domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RP.VISIT: VISIT in RP domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.VISITDY: VISITDY in RP domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.TAETORD: TAETORD in RP domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.EPOCH: EPOCH in RP domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPDTC: RPDTC in RP domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of an observation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RP.RPDY: RPDY in RP domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPDUR: RPDUR in RP domain | Label: Duration | Description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPTPT: RPTPT in RP domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPTPTNUM: RPTPTNUM in RP domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPELTM: RPELTM in RP domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (RPTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPTPTREF: RPTPTREF in RP domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by RPELTM, RPTPTNUM, and RPTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RP.RPRFTDTC: RPRFTDTC in RP domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RPTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.STUDYID: STUDYID in RS domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RS.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in RS domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RS.USUBJID: USUBJID in RS domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RS.RSSEQ: RSSEQ in RS domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RS.RSGRPID: RSGRPID in RS domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSREFID: RSREFID in RS domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSSPID: RSSPID in RS domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSLNKID: RSLNKID in RS domain | Label: Link ID | Description: An identifier used to link the response assessment to the related measurement record in another domain which was used to determine the response result. LNKID values group records within USUBJID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSLNKGRP: RSLNKGRP in RS domain | Label: Link Group ID | Description: A grouping identifier used to link the response assessment to a group of measurement/assessment records which were used in the assessment of the response. LNKGRP values group records within USUBJID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSTESTCD: RSTESTCD in RS domain | Label: Assessment Short Name | Description: Short name of the TEST in RSTEST. The value in RSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "TRGRESP", "NTRGRESP", "OVRLRESP", "SYMPTDTR", "CPS0102". \n There are separate codelists used for RSTESTCD where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTSCD" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: TRGRESP, "NTRGRESP, "OVRLRESP". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RS.RSTEST: RSTEST in RS domain | Label: Assessment Name | Description: Verbatim name of the response assessment. The value in RSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n There are separate codelists used for RSTEST where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTS" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: "Target Response", "Non-target Response", "Overall Response", "Symptomatic Deterioration". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
RS.RSCAT: RSCAT in RS domain | Label: Category for Assessment | Description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: "RECIST 1.1", "CHILD-PUGH CLASSIFICATION". There are separate codelists used for RSCAT where the choice depends on whether the related records are about an oncology response criterion or another clinical classification. \n RSCAT is required for clinical classifications other than oncology response criteria. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RS.RSSCAT: RSSCAT in RS domain | Label: Subcategory | Description: Used to define a further categorization of RSCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSORRES: RSORRES in RS domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the response assessment as originally received, collected, or calculated. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RS.RSORRESU: RSORRESU in RS domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Unit for RSORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSSTRESC: RSSTRESC in RS domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for the response assessment, copied, or derived from RSORRES in a standard format or standard units. RSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format. \n For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RS.RSSTRESN: RSSTRESN in RS domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSSTRESU: RSSTRESU in RS domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized units used for RSSTRESC and RSSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSSTAT: RSSTAT in RS domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate the response assessment was not performed. Should be null if a result exists in RSORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSREASND: RSREASND in RS domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a response assessment was not performed. Examples: "All target tumors not evaluated", "Subject does not have non-target tumors". Used in conjunction with RSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSNAM: RSNAM in RS domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the response assessment. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSMETHOD: RSMETHOD in RS domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of the test or examination. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSLOBXFL: RSLOBXFL in RS domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. \n When a clinical classification is assessed at multiple times, including baseline, RSLOBXFL should be included in the dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSBLFL: RSBLFL in RS domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that --BLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSDRVFL: RSDRVFL in RS domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSEVAL: RSEVAL in RS domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST". \n RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However, the column should contain no null values when data from one or more independent assessors is included, meaning that the rows attributed to the investigator should contain a value of "INVESTIGATOR". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSEVALID: RSEVALID in RS domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in RSEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See assumptions in Section 6.3.9.3.1, Disease Response Use Case. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSACPTFL: RSACPTFL in RS domain | Label: Accepted Record Flag | Description: In cases where more than 1 independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATOR") provides an evaluation of response, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted evaluation. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in RS domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RS.VISIT: VISIT in RS domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.VISITDY: VISITDY in RS domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.TAETORD: TAETORD in RS domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.EPOCH: EPOCH in RS domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSDTC: RSDTC in RS domain | Label: Date/Time of Assessment | Description: Collection date and time of the assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
RS.RSDY: RSDY in RS domain | Label: Study Day of Assessment | Description: Study day of the assessment, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSTPT: RSTPT in RS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See RSTPTNUM and RSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSTPTNUM: RSTPTNUM in RS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSELTM: RSELTM in RS domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (RSTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSTPTREF: RSTPTREF in RS domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by RSELTM, RSTPTNUM, and RSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSRFTDTC: RSRFTDTC in RS domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RSTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSEVLINT: RSEVLINT in RS domain | Label: Evaluation Interval | Description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding RSTESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2M" to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSEVINTX: RSEVINTX in RS domain | Label: Evaluation Interval Text | Description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSSTRTPT: RSSTRTPT in RS domain | Label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSSTTPT: RSSTTPT in RS domain | Label: Start Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSENRTPT: RSENRTPT in RS domain | Label: End Relative to Reference Time Point | Description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
RS.RSENTPT: RSENTPT in RS domain | Label: End Reference Time Point | Description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.STUDYID: STUDYID in SC domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SC.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in SC domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SC.USUBJID: USUBJID in SC domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SC.SCSEQ: SCSEQ in SC domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SC.SCGRPID: SCGRPID in SC domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCSPID: SCSPID in SC domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCTESTCD: SCTESTCD in SC domain | Label: Subject Characteristic Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SCTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MARISTAT", "NATORIG". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SC.SCTEST: SCTEST in SC domain | Label: Subject Characteristic | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in SCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Marital Status", "National Origin". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SC.SCCAT: SCCAT in SC domain | Label: Category for Subject Characteristic | Description: Used to define a category of related records. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCSCAT: SCSCAT in SC domain | Label: Subcategory for Subject Characteristic | Description: A further categorization of the subject characteristic. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCORRES: SCORRES in SC domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the subject characteristic as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
SC.SCORRESU: SCORRESU in SC domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original unit in which the data were collected. The unit for SCORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCSTRESC: SCSTRESC in SC domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from SCORRES, in a standard format or standard units. SCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in SCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in SCORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in SCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
SC.SCSTRESN: SCSTRESN in SC domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from SCSTRESC. SCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCSTRESU: SCSTRESU in SC domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for SCSTRESC or SCSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCSTAT: SCSTAT in SC domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in SCORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCREASND: SCREASND in SC domain | Label: Reason Not Performed | Description: Describes why the observation has no result. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with SCSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in SC domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.VISIT: VISIT in SC domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.VISITDY: VISITDY in SC domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.TAETORD: TAETORD in SC domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.EPOCH: EPOCH in SC domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCDTC: SCDTC in SC domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of the subject characteristic represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SC.SCDY: SCDY in SC domain | Label: Study Day of Examination | Description: Study day of collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SS.STUDYID: STUDYID in SS domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SS.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in SS domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SS.USUBJID: USUBJID in SS domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SS.SSSEQ: SSSEQ in SS domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
SS.SSGRPID: SSGRPID in SS domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
SS.SSSPID: SSSPID in SS domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the Procedure or Test page. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings

UR.VISIT: VISIT in UR domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.VISITDY: VISITDY in UR domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.TAETORD: TAETORD in UR domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the observation was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.EPOCH: EPOCH in UR domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the observation was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.URDTC: URDTC in UR domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of an observation. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
UR.URDY: URDY in UR domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.URTPT: URTPT in UR domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See URTPTNUM and URTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.URTPTNUM: URTPTNUM in UR domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.URELTM: URELTM in UR domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (URTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.URTPTREF: URTPTREF in UR domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by URELTM, URTPTNUM, and URTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
UR.URRFTDTC: URRFTDTC in UR domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by URTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.STUDYID: STUDYID in VS domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
VS.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in VS domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
VS.USUBJID: USUBJID in VS domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
VS.VSSEQ: VSSEQ in VS domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings
VS.VSGRPID: VSGRPID in VS domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSSPID: VSSPID in VS domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSTESTCD: VSTESTCD in VS domain | Label: Vital Signs Test Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in VSTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in VSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). VSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SYSBP", "DIABP", "BMI". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
VS.VSTEST: VSTEST in VS domain | Label: Vital Signs Test Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in VSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Systolic Blood Pressure", "Diastolic Blood Pressure", "Body Mass Index". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings
VS.VSCAT: VSCAT in VS domain | Label: Category for Vital Signs | Description: Used to define a category of related records. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSSCAT: VSSCAT in VS domain | Label: Subcategory for Vital Signs | Description: A further categorization of a measurement or examination. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSPOS: VSPOS in VS domain | Label: Vital Signs Position of Subject | Description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSORRES: VSORRES in VS domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VSORRESU: VSORRESU in VS domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for VSORRES. Examples: "in", "LB", "beats/min". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VSSTRESC: VSSTRESC in VS domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from VSORRES in a standard format or standard units. VSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in VSSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in VSORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in VSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VSSTRESN: VSSTRESN in VS domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from VSSTRESC. VSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VSSTRESU: VSSTRESU in VS domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for VSSTRESC and VSSTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VSSTAT: VSSTAT in VS domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that a vital sign measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in VSORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSREASND: VSREASND in VS domain | Label: Reason Not Performed | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with VSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSLOC: VSLOC in VS domain | Label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement | Description: Location relevant to the collection of vital signs measurement. Example: "ARM" for blood pressure. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSLAT: VSLAT in VS domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSLOBXFL: VSLOBXFL in VS domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VSBLFL: VSBLFL in VS domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that VSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSDRVFL: VSDRVFL in VS domain | Label: Derived Flag | Description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records or that do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If VSDRVFL = "Y," then VSORRES may be null, with VSSTRESC and (if numeric) VSSTRESN having the derived value. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSTOX: VSTOX in VS domain | Label: Toxicity | Description: Description of toxicity quantified by VSTOXGR. The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSTOXGR: VSTOXGR in VS domain | Label: Standard Toxicity Grade | Description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2", not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSCLSIG: VSCLSIG in VS domain | Label: Clinically Significant, Collected | Description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in VS domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VISIT: VISIT in VS domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VISITDY: VISITDY in VS domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.TAETORD: TAETORD in VS domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.EPOCH: EPOCH in VS domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the start date/time at which the assessment was made. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSDTC: VSDTC in VS domain | Label: Date/Time of Measurements | Description: Date and time of the vital signs assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings
VS.VSDY: VSDY in VS domain | Label: Study Day of Vital Signs | Description: Study day of vital signs measurements, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSTPT: VSTPT in VS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See VSTPTNUM and VSTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSTPTNUM: VSTPTNUM in VS domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of VSTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSELTM: VSELTM in VS domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (VSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 Duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSTPTREF: VSTPTREF in VS domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by VSELTM, VSTPTNUM, and VSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
VS.VSRFTDTC: VSRFTDTC in VS domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point, VSTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings
FA.STUDYID: STUDYID in FA domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
FA.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in FA domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
FA.USUBJID: USUBJID in FA domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
FA.FASEQ: FASEQ in FA domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
FA.FAGRPID: FAGRPID in FA domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FASPID: FASPID in FA domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FATESTCD: FATESTCD in FA domain | Label: Findings About Test Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in FATEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in FATESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FATESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SEV", "OCCUR". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATESTCD general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
FA.FATEST: FATEST in FA domain | Label: Findings About Test Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in FATEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Severity/Intensity", "Occurrence". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATEST general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
FA.FAOBJ: FAOBJ in FA domain | Label: Object of the Observation | Description: Used to describe the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by --TEST. Examples: the term (e.g., "Acne") describing a clinical sign or symptom that is being measured by a severity test; an event (e.g., "VOMIT, where the volume of vomit is being measured by a VOLUME test). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
FA.FACAT: FACAT in FA domain | Label: Category for Findings About | Description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "GERD", "PRE-SPECIFIED AE". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FASCAT: FASCAT in FA domain | Label: Subcategory for Findings About | Description: A further categorization of FACAT. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FAORRES: FAORRES in FA domain | Label: Result or Finding in Original Units | Description: Result of the test as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings About
FA.FAORRESU: FAORRESU in FA domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for FAORRES. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FASTRESC: FASTRESC in FA domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FAORRES in a standard format or standard units. FASTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FASTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in FAORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning; they could be represented in standard format in FASTRESC as "NEGATIVE". | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings About
FA.FASTRESN: FASTRESN in FA domain | Label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units | Description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FASTRESC. FASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FASTRESU: FASTRESU in FA domain | Label: Standard Units | Description: Standardized unit used for FASTRESC and FASTRESN. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FASTAT: FASTAT in FA domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in FAORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FAREASND: FAREASND in FA domain | Label: Reason Not Performed | Description: Describes why a question was not answered. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with FASTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FALOC: FALOC in FA domain | Label: Location of the Finding About | Description: Used to specify the location of the clinical evaluation. Example: "ARM". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FALAT: FALAT in FA domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FALOBXFL: FALOBXFL in FA domain | Label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag | Description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FABLFL: FABLFL in FA domain | Label: Baseline Flag | Description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FABLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FAEVAL: FAEVAL in FA domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in FA domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: 1. Clinical encounter number. \n 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Findings About
FA.VISIT: VISIT in FA domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. \n 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.VISITDY: VISITDY in FA domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.TAETORD: TAETORD in FA domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.EPOCH: EPOCH in FA domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time of the observation. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
FA.FADTC: FADTC in FA domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of findings assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings About
FA.FADY: FADY in FA domain | Label: Study Day of Collection | Description: 1. Study day of collection, measured as integer days. \n 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.STUDYID: STUDYID in SR domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About

SR.USUBJID: USUBJID in SR domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
SR.SRSEQ: SRSEQ in SR domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Findings About
SR.SRGRPID: SRGRPID in SR domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRREFID: SRREFID in SR domain | Label: Reference ID | Description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: "Specimen ID". | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRSPID: SRSPID in SR domain | Label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRTESTCD: SRTESTCD in SR domain | Label: Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name | Description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SRTEST. SR.SRTEST: SRTEST in SR domain | Label: Skin Response Test or Examination Name | Description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. SR.SROBJ: SROBJ in SR domain | Label: Object of the Observation | Description: Used to describe the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by --TEST. SR.SRCAT: SRCAT in SR domain | Label: Category for Test | Description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRSCAT: SRSCAT in SR domain | Label: Subcategory for Test | Description: A further categorization of SRCAT values. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRORRES: SRORRES in SR domain | Label: Results or Findings in Original Units | Description: Results of measurement or finding as originally received or collected. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings About
SR.SRORRESU: SRORRESU in SR domain | Label: Original Units | Description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for SRORRES. Example: "mm". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings About
SR.SRSTRESC: SRSTRESC in SR domain | Label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format | Description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from SRORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. SR.SRSTAT: SRSTAT in SR domain | Label: Completion Status | Description: Used to indicate exam not done. Should be null if a result exists in SRORRES. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRREASND: SRREASND in SR domain | Label: Reason Not Done | Description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Used in conjunction with SRSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRNAM: SRNAM in SR domain | Label: Vendor Name | Description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provided the test results. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRSPEC: SRSPEC in SR domain | Label: Specimen Type | Description: Defines the types of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SKIN". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRLOC: SRLOC in SR domain | Label: Location Used for Measurement | Description: Location relevant to the collection of the measurement. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRLAT: SRLAT in SR domain | Label: Laterality | Description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of intervention administration. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRMETHOD: SRMETHOD in SR domain | Label: Method of Test or Examination | Description: Method of test or examination. Examples: "ELISA", "EIA", "MICRONEUTRALIZATION ASSAY", "PLAQUE REDUCTION NEUTRALIZATION ASSAY". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
