SR.VISIT: VISIT in SR domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.VISITDY: VISITDY in SR domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.TAETORD: TAETORD in SR domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.EPOCH: EPOCH in SR domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the date/time of the observation. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", and "FOLLOW-UP". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRDTC: SRDTC in SR domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Collection date and time of an observation represented in ISO 8601. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Findings About
SR.SRDY: SRDY in SR domain | Label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam | Description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to sponsor- defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRTPT: SRTPT in SR domain | Label: Planned Time Point Name | Description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See SRTPTNUM and SRTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRTPTNUM: SRTPTNUM in SR domain | Label: Planned Time Point Number | Description: Numerical version of SRTPT to aid in sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRELTM: SRELTM in SR domain | Label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref | Description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (SRTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by SRTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRTPTREF: SRTPTREF in SR domain | Label: Time Point Reference | Description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by SRELTM, SRTPTNUM, and SRTPT. Example: "INTRADERMAL INJECTION". | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
SR.SRRFTDTC: SRRFTDTC in SR domain | Label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point | Description: Date/time of the reference time point, SRTPTREF. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Findings About
CO.STUDYID: STUDYID in CO domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in CO domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.RDOMAIN: RDOMAIN in CO domain | Label: Related Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s). Null for comments collected on a general comments or additional information CRF page. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.USUBJID: USUBJID in CO domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.COSEQ: COSEQ in CO domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.IDVAR: IDVAR in CO domain | Label: Identifying Variable | Description: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies the record(s) to which the comment applies. Examples AESEQ or CMGRPID. Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.IDVARVAL: IDVARVAL in CO domain | Label: Identifying Variable Value | Description: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s). Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.COREF: COREF in CO domain | Label: Comment Reference | Description: Sponsor-defined reference associated with the comment. May be the CRF page number (e.g., 650), or a module name (e.g., DEMOG), or a combination of information that identifies the reference (e.g. 650-VITALS-VISIT 2). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.COVAL: COVAL in CO domain | Label: Comment | Description: The text of the comment. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns COVAL1-COVALn. See Assumption 3. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.COEVAL: COEVAL in CO domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Example: "INVESTIGATOR". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.COEVALID: COEVALID in CO domain | Label: Evaluator Identifier | Description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST", "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.CODTC: CODTC in CO domain | Label: Date/Time of Comment | Description: Date/time of comment on dedicated comment form. Should be null if this is a child record of another domain or if comment date was not collected. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
CO.CODY: CODY in CO domain | Label: Study Day of Comment | Description: Study day of the comment, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.STUDYID: STUDYID in DM domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in DM domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.USUBJID: USUBJID in DM domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This must be a unique value, and could be a compound identifier formed by concatenating STUDYID-SITEID-SUBJID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.SUBJID: SUBJID in DM domain | Label: Subject Identifier for the Study | Description: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFSTDTC: RFSTDTC in DM domain | Label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time | Description: Reference start date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. See assumption 9 for additional detail on when RFSTDTC may be null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFENDTC: RFENDTC in DM domain | Label: Subject Reference End Date/Time | Description: Reference end date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to the date/time when subject was determined to have ended the trial, and often equivalent to date/time of last exposure to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFXSTDTC: RFXSTDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment | Description: First date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFXENDTC: RFXENDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment | Description: Last date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFCSTDTC: RFCSTDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin | Description: Used only when protocol specifies a challenge agent to induce a condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Equal to the earliest value of AGSTDTC for the challenge agent. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFCENDTC: RFCENDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin | Description: Used only when protocol specifies a challenge agent to induce a condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Equal to the latest value of AGENDTC for the challenge agent (or the latest value of AGSTDTC if AGENDTC was not collected or is missing). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFICDTC: RFICDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of Informed Consent | Description: Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented. Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RFPENDTC: RFPENDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of End of Participation | Description: Date/time when subject ended participation or follow-up in a trial, as defined in the protocol, in ISO 8601 character format. Should correspond to the last known date of contact. Examples include completion date, withdrawal date, last follow-up, date recorded for lost to follow up, and death date. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.DTHDTC: DTHDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of Death | Description: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO 8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.DTHFL: DTHFL in DM domain | Label: Subject Death Flag | Description: Indicates the subject died. Should be "Y" or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.SITEID: SITEID in DM domain | Label: Study Site Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a site within a study. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.INVID: INVID in DM domain | Label: Investigator Identifier | Description: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.INVNAM: INVNAM in DM domain | Label: Investigator Name | Description: Name of the investigator for a site. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.BRTHDTC: BRTHDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of Birth | Description: Date/time of birth of the subject. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.AGE: AGE in DM domain | Label: Age | Description: Age expressed in AGEU. May be derived from RFSTDTC and BRTHDTC, but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.AGEU: AGEU in DM domain | Label: Age Units | Description: Units associated with AGE. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.SEX: SEX in DM domain | Label: Sex | Description: Sex of the subject. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.RACE: RACE in DM domain | Label: Race | Description: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidance2 regarding the collection of race. See assumption below regarding RACE. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.ETHNIC: ETHNIC in DM domain | Label: Ethnicity | Description: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidance1 regarding the collection of ethnicity. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.ARMCD: ARMCD in DM domain | Label: Planned Arm Code | Description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. If the subject was not assigned to a trial arm, ARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms dataset. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.ARM: ARM in DM domain | Label: Description of Planned Arm | Description: Name of the arm to which the subject was assigned. If the subject was not assigned to an arm, ARM is null and ARMNRS is populated. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms dataset. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.ACTARMCD: ACTARMCD in DM domain | Label: Actual Arm Code | Description: Code of actual arm. ACTARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD. The maximum length of ACTARMCD is longer than for other short variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms dataset. \n If the subject was not assigned to an arm or followed a course not described by any planned arm, ACTARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.ACTARM: ACTARM in DM domain | Label: Description of Actual Arm | Description: Description of actual arm. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms dataset. \n If the subject was not assigned to an arm or followed a course not described by any planned arm, ACTARM is null and ARMNRS is populated. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.ARMNRS: ARMNRS in DM domain | Label: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null | Description: A coded reason that arm variables (ARM and ARMCD) and/or actual arm variables (ACTARM and ACTARMCD) are null. Examples: "SCREEN FAILURE", "NOT ASSIGNED", "ASSIGNED, NOT TREATED", "UNPLANNED TREATMENT". It is assumed that if the arm and actual arm variables are null, the same reason applies to both arm and actual arm. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.ACTARMUD: ACTARMUD in DM domain | Label: Description of Unplanned Actual Arm | Description: A description of actual treatment for a subject who did not receive treatment described in a planned trial arm. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.COUNTRY: COUNTRY in DM domain | Label: Country | Description: Country of the investigational site in which the subject participated in the trial. \n \n Generally represented using ISO 3166-1 Alpha-3. Note that regulatory agency specific requirements (e.g., US FDA) may require other terminologies; in such cases, follow regulatory requirements. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.DMDTC: DMDTC in DM domain | Label: Date/Time of Collection | Description: Date/time of demographic data collection. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
DM.DMDY: DMDY in DM domain | Label: Study Day of Collection | Description: Study day of collection measured as integer days. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.STUDYID: STUDYID in SE domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in SE domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.USUBJID: USUBJID in SE domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.SESEQ: SESEQ in SE domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. Should be assigned to be consistent chronological order. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.ETCD: ETCD in SE domain | Label: Element Code | Description: 1. ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name. \n 2. If an encountered element differs from the planned element to the point that it is considered a new element, then use "UNPLAN" as the value for ETCD to represent this element. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.ELEMENT: ELEMENT in SE domain | Label: Description of Element | Description: The name of the element. If ETCD has a value of "UNPLAN", then ELEMENT should be null. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.TAETORD: TAETORD in SE domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the subject's assigned trial arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.EPOCH: EPOCH in SE domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Epoch associated with the element in the planned sequence of elements for the arm to which the subject was assigned. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.SESTDTC: SESTDTC in SE domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Element | Description: Start date/time for an element for each subject. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.SEENDTC: SEENDTC in SE domain | Label: End Date/Time of Element | Description: End date/time for an element for each subject. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.SESTDY: SESTDY in SE domain | Label: Study Day of Start of Element | Description: Study day of start of element relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.SEENDY: SEENDY in SE domain | Label: Study Day of End of Element | Description: Study day of end of element relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SE.SEUPDES: SEUPDES in SE domain | Label: Description of Unplanned Element | Description: Description of what happened to the subject during an unplanned element. Used only if ETCD has the value of "UNPLAN". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.STUDYID: STUDYID in SM domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in SM domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.USUBJID: USUBJID in SM domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.SMSEQ: SMSEQ in SM domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records. Should be assigned to be consistent chronological order. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.MIDS: MIDS in SM domain | Label: Disease Milestone Instance Name | Description: Name of the specific disease milestone. For types of disease milestones that can occur multiple times, the name will end with a sequence number. Example: "HYPO1". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.MIDSTYPE: MIDSTYPE in SM domain | Label: Disease Milestone Type | Description: The type of disease milestone. Example: "HYPOGLYCEMIC EVENT". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.SMSTDTC: SMSTDTC in SM domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Milestone | Description: Start date/time of milestone instance (if milestone is an intervention or event) or date of milestone (if Milestone is a finding). | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.SMENDTC: SMENDTC in SM domain | Label: End Date/Time of Milestone | Description: End date/time of disease milestone instance. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.SMSTDY: SMSTDY in SM domain | Label: Study Day of Start of Milestone | Description: Study day of start of disease milestone instance, relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SM.SMENDY: SMENDY in SM domain | Label: Study Day of End of Milestone | Description: Study day of end of disease milestone instance, relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.STUDYID: STUDYID in SV domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in SV domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.USUBJID: USUBJID in SV domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in SV domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Topic | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.VISIT: VISIT in SV domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVPRESP: SVPRESP in SV domain | Label: Pre-specified | Description: Used to indicate whether the visit was planned (i.e., visits specified in the TV domain). Value is "Y" for planned visits, null for unplanned visits. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVOCCUR: SVOCCUR in SV domain | Label: Occurrence | Description: Used to record whether a planned visit occurred. The value is null for unplanned visits. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVREASOC: SVREASOC in SV domain | Label: Reason for Occur Value | Description: The reason for the value in SVOCCUR. If SVOCCUR="N", SVREASOC is the reason the visit did not occur. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVCNTMOD: SVCNTMOD in SV domain | Label: Contact Mode | Description: The way in which the visit was conducted. Examples: "IN PERSON", "TELEPHONE CALL", "IVRS". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVEPCHGI: SVEPCHGI in SV domain | Label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator | Description: Indicates whether the visit was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.VISITDY: VISITDY in SV domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVSTDTC: SVSTDTC in SV domain | Label: Start Date/Time of Observation | Description: Start date/time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVENDTC: SVENDTC in SV domain | Label: End Date/Time of Observation | Description: End date/time of the observation represented in IS0 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVSTDY: SVSTDY in SV domain | Label: Study Day of Start of Observation | Description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVENDY: SVENDY in SV domain | Label: Study Day of End of Observation | Description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
SV.SVUPDES: SVUPDES in SV domain | Label: Description of Unplanned Visit | Description: Description of what happened to the subject during an unplanned visit. Only populated for unplanned visits. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Special-Purpose
TA.STUDYID: STUDYID in TA domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TA.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in TA domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TA.ARMCD: ARMCD in TA domain | Label: Planned Arm Code | Description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than that for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TA.ARM: ARM in TA domain | Label: Description of Planned Arm | Description: Name given to an arm or treatment group. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TA.TAETORD: TAETORD in TA domain | Label: Planned Order of Element within Arm | Description: Number that gives the order of the element within the arm. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TA.ETCD: ETCD in TA domain | Label: Element Code | Description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TA.ELEMENT: ELEMENT in TA domain | Label: Description of Element | Description: The name of the element. The same element may occur more than once within an arm. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TA.TABRANCH: TABRANCH in TA domain | Label: Branch | Description: Condition subject met, at a "branch" in the trial design at the end of this element, to be included in this arm (e.g., "Randomization to DRUG X"). | Role: Rule | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Trial Design
TA.TATRANS: TATRANS in TA domain | Label: Transition Rule | Description: If the trial design allows a subject to transition to an element other than the next element in sequence, then the conditions for transitioning to those other elements, and the alternative element sequences, are specified in this rule (e.g., "Responders go to washout"). | Role: Rule | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Trial Design
TA.EPOCH: EPOCH in TA domain | Label: Epoch | Description: Name of the trial epoch with which this element of the arm is associated. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.STUDYID: STUDYID in TD domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in TD domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.TDORDER: TDORDER in TD domain | Label: Sequence of Planned Assessment Schedule | Description: A number given to ensure ordinal sequencing of the planned assessment schedules within a trial. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.TDANCVAR: TDANCVAR in TD domain | Label: Anchor Variable Name | Description: A reference to the date variable name that provides the start point from which the planned disease assessment schedule is measured. This must be a referenced from the ADaM ADSL dataset (e.g., "ANCH1DT"). Note: TDANCVAR will contain the name of a reference date variable. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.TDSTOFF: TDSTOFF in TD domain | Label: Offset from the Anchor | Description: A fixed offset from the date provided by the variable referenced in TDANCVAR. This is used when the timing of planned cycles does not start on the exact day referenced in the variable indicated in TDANCVAR. The value of this variable will be either zero or a positive value and will be represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.TDTGTPAI: TDTGTPAI in TD domain | Label: Planned Assessment Interval | Description: The planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.TDMINPAI: TDMINPAI in TD domain | Label: Planned Assessment Interval Minimum | Description: The lower limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.TDMAXPAI: TDMAXPAI in TD domain | Label: Planned Assessment Interval Maximum | Description: The upper limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TD.TDNUMRPT: TDNUMRPT in TD domain | Label: Maximum Number of Actual Assessments | Description: This variable must represent the maximum number of actual assessments for the analysis that this disease assessment schedule describes. In a trial where the maximum number of assessments is not defined explicitly in the protocol (e.g., assessments occur until death), TDNUMRPT should represent the maximum number of disease assessments that support the efficacy analysis encountered by any subject across the trial at that point in time. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TE.STUDYID: STUDYID in TE domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TE.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in TE domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TE.ETCD: ETCD in TE domain | Label: Element Code | Description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TE.ELEMENT: ELEMENT in TE domain | Label: Description of Element | Description: The name of the element. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TE.TESTRL: TESTRL in TE domain | Label: Rule for Start of Element | Description: Describes condition for beginning element. | Role: Rule | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TE.TEENRL: TEENRL in TE domain | Label: Rule for End of Element | Description: Describes condition for ending element. Either TEENRL or TEDUR must be present for each element. | Role: Rule | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TE.TEDUR: TEDUR in TE domain | Label: Planned Duration of Element | Description: Planned duration of element in ISO 8601 format. Used when the rule for ending the element is applied after a fixed duration. | Role: Timing | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TI.STUDYID: STUDYID in TI domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TI.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in TI domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TI.IETESTCD: IETESTCD in TI domain | Label: Incl/Excl Criterion Short Name | Description: Short name IETEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TI.IETEST: IETEST in TI domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion | Description: Full text of the inclusion or exclusion criterion. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TI.IECAT: IECAT in TI domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category | Description: Used for categorization of the inclusion or exclusion criteria. | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TI.IESCAT: IESCAT in TI domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory | Description: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or to categorize as major or minor exceptions. Examples: "MAJOR", "MINOR". | Role: Grouping Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TI.TIRL: TIRL in TI domain | Label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Rule | Description: Rule that expresses the criterion in computer-executable form. See Assumption 4. | Role: Rule | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TI.TIVERS: TIVERS in TI domain | Label: Protocol Criteria Versions | Description: The number of this version of the Inclusion/Exclusion criteria. May be omitted if there is only 1 version. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TM.STUDYID: STUDYID in TM domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TM.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in TM domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TM. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TM.MIDSTYPE: MIDSTYPE in TM domain | Label: Disease Milestone Type | Description: The type of disease milestone. Example: "HYPOGLYCEMIC EVENT". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TM.TMDEF: TMDEF in TM domain | Label: Disease Milestone Definition | Description: Definition of the disease milestone. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TM.TMRPT: TMRPT in TM domain | Label: Disease Milestone Repetition Indicator | Description: Indicates whether this is a disease milestone that can occur only once ("N") or a type of disease milestone that can occur multiple times ("Y"). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TS.STUDYID: STUDYID in TS domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TS.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in TS domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSSEQ: TSSEQ in TS domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter. Allows inclusion of multiple records for the same TSPARMCD. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSGRPID: TSGRPID in TS domain | Label: Group ID | Description: Used to tie together a group of related records. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSPARMCD: TSPARMCD in TS domain | Label: Trial Summary Parameter Short Name | Description: TSPARMCD (the companion to TSPARM) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that TSPARMCD will need to serve as variable names. Examples: "AGEMIN", "AGEMAX". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSPARM: TSPARM in TS domain | Label: Trial Summary Parameter | Description: Term for the trial summary parameter. The value in TSPARM cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Planned Minimum Age of Subjects", "Planned Maximum Age of Subjects". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSVAL: TSVAL in TS domain | Label: Parameter Value | Description: Value of TSPARM. Example: "ASTHMA" when TSPARM value is "Trial Indication". TSVAL can only be null when TSVALNF is populated. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns TSVAL1-TSVALn. See Assumption 8. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSVALNF: TSVALNF in TS domain | Label: Parameter Value Null Flavor | Description: Null flavor for the value of TSPARM, to be populated only if TSVAL is null. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSVALCD: TSVALCD in TS domain | Label: Parameter Value Code | Description: This is the code of the term in TSVAL. For example, "6CW7F3G59X" is the code for gabapentin; "C49488" is the code for Y. The length of this variable can be longer than 8 to accommodate the length of the external terminology. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSVCDREF: TSVCDREF in TS domain | Label: Name of the Reference Terminology | Description: The name of the reference terminology from which TSVALCD is taken. For example; CDISC CT, SNOMED, ISO 8601. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Trial Design
TS.TSVCDVER: TSVCDVER in TS domain | Label: Version of the Reference Terminology | Description: The version number of the reference terminology, if applicable. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Trial Design
TV.STUDYID: STUDYID in TV domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TV.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in TV domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TV.VISITNUM: VISITNUM in TV domain | Label: Visit Number | Description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting. | Role: Topic | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TV.VISIT: VISIT in TV domain | Label: Visit Name | Description: Description of clinical encounter. This is often defined in the protocol. Used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY as a text description of the clinical encounter. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TV.VISITDY: VISITDY in TV domain | Label: Planned Study Day of Visit | Description: Planned study day of VISIT. Due to its sequential nature, used for sorting. | Role: Timing | Type: Num | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TV.ARMCD: ARMCD in TV domain | Label: Planned Arm Code | Description: 1. ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then ARMCD should be null. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Trial Design
TV.ARM: ARM in TV domain | Label: Description of Planned Arm | Description: 1. Name given to an arm or treatment group. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then Arm should be left blank. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
TV.TVSTRL: TVSTRL in TV domain | Label: Visit Start Rule | Description: Rule describing when the visit starts, in relation to the sequence of elements. | Role: Rule | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Trial Design
TV.TVENRL: TVENRL in TV domain | Label: Visit End Rule | Description: Rule describing when the visit ends, in relation to the sequence of elements. | Role: Rule | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Trial Design
OI.STUDYID: STUDYID in OI domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Study Reference
OI.DOMAIN: DOMAIN in OI domain | Label: Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Study Reference
OI.NHOID: NHOID in OI domain | Label: Non-host Organism Identifier | Description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism. NHOID should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the organism as reported by the lab. It must be unique for each unique organism as defined by the specific values of the organism's entire known taxonomy described by pairs of OIPARMCD and OIVAL . | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Study Reference
OI.OISEQ: OISEQ in OI domain | Label: Sequence Number | Description: Sequence number to given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter within an organism (NHOID) within dataset. | Role: Identifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Study Reference
OI.OIPARMCD: OIPARMCD in OI domain | Label: Non-host Organism ID Element Short Name | Description: Short name of the taxon being described. Examples: "GROUP", "GENTYP", "SUBTYP". | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Study Reference
OI.OIPARM: OIPARM in OI domain | Label: Non-host Organism ID Element Name | Description: Name of the taxon being described. Examples: "Group", "Genotype", "Subtype". | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Study Reference
OI.OIVAL: OIVAL in OI domain | Label: Non-host Organism ID Element Value | Description: Value for the taxon in OIPARMCD/OIPARM for the organism identified by NHOID. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Study Reference
RELREC.STUDYID: STUDYID in RELREC domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELREC.RDOMAIN: RDOMAIN in RELREC domain | Label: Related Domain Abbreviation | Description: Abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELREC.USUBJID: USUBJID in RELREC domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
RELREC.IDVAR: IDVAR in RELREC domain | Label: Identifying Variable | Description: Name of the identifying variable in the general-observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELREC.IDVARVAL: IDVARVAL in RELREC domain | Label: Identifying Variable Value | Description: Value of identifying variable described in IDVAR. If --SEQ is the variable being used to describe this record, then the value of --SEQ would be entered here. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
RELREC.RELTYPE: RELTYPE in RELREC domain | Label: Relationship Type | Description: Identifies the hierarchical level of the records in the relationship. Values should be either "ONE" or "MANY". Used only when identifying a relationship between datasets (as described in Section 8.3, Relating Datasets). | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
RELREC.RELID: RELID in RELREC domain | Label: Relationship Identifier | Description: Unique value within USUBJID that identifies the relationship. All records for the same USUBJID that have the same RELID are considered related/associated. RELID can be any value the sponsor chooses, and is only meaningful within the RELREC dataset to identify the related/associated domain records. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELSPEC.STUDYID: STUDYID in RELSPEC domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELSPEC.USUBJID: USUBJID in RELSPEC domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELSPEC.REFID: REFID in RELSPEC domain | Label: Specimen ID | Description: Specimen identifier, unique within USUBJID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELSPEC.SPEC: SPEC in RELSPEC domain | Label: Specimen Type | Description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE", "SOFT TISSUE". | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Relationship
RELSPEC.PARENT: PARENT in RELSPEC domain | Label: Specimen Parent | Description: Identifies the REFID of the parent of a specimen to support tracking its genealogy. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
RELSPEC.LEVEL: LEVEL in RELSPEC domain | Label: Specimen Level | Description: Identifies the generation number of the sample where the collected sample is considered the first generation. | Role: Variable Qualifier | Type: Num | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELSUB.STUDYID: STUDYID in RELSUB domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Unique identifier for a study. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELSUB.USUBJID: USUBJID in RELSUB domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
RELSUB.POOLID: POOLID in RELSUB domain | Label: Pool Identifier | Description: Identifier used to identify a pool of subjects. If POOLID is entered, POOLDEF records must exist for each subject in the pool and USUBJID must be null. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Perm | Class: Relationship
RELSUB.RSUBJID: RSUBJID in RELSUB domain | Label: Related Subject or Pool Identifier | Description: Identifier used to identify a related subject or pool of subjects. RSUBJID will be populated with either the USUBJID of the related subject or the POOLID of the related pool. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
RELSUB.SREL: SREL in RELSUB domain | Label: Subject Relationship | Description: Describes the relationship of the subject identified in USUBJID or the pool identified in POOLID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.STUDYID: STUDYID in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Study Identifier | Description: Study identifier of the parent record(s). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.RDOMAIN: RDOMAIN in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Related Domain Abbreviation | Description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.USUBJID: USUBJID in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Unique Subject Identifier | Description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This is the value of USUBJID in the parent record(s). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.IDVAR: IDVAR in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Identifying Variable | Description: Identifying variable in the dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID. | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.IDVARVAL: IDVARVAL in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Identifying Variable Value | Description: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s). | Role: Identifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.QNAM: QNAM in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Qualifier Variable Name | Description: The short name of the qualifier variable, which is used as a column name in a domain view with data from the parent domain. The value in QNAM cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). QNAM cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. This will often be the column name in the sponsor's operational dataset. | Role: Topic | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.QLABEL: QLABEL in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Qualifier Variable Label | Description: This is the long name or label associated with QNAM. The value in QLABEL cannot be longer than 40 characters. This will often be the column label in the sponsor's original dataset. | Role: Synonym Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.QVAL: QVAL in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Data Value | Description: Result of, response to, or value associated with QNAM. A value for this column is required; no records can be in SUPP-- with a null value for QVAL. | Role: Result Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.QORIG: QORIG in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Origin | Description: Because QVAL can represent a mixture of collected (on a CRF), derived, or assigned items, QORIG is used to indicate the origin of this data. Examples: "CRF", "Assigned", "Derived". See Section 4.1.8, Origin Metadata. | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Req | Class: Relationship
SUPPQUAL.QEVAL: QEVAL in SUPPQUAL domain | Label: Evaluator | Description: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain objectively collected or derived data. Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "STATISTICIAN", "DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR", "CLINICAL COORDINATOR". | Role: Record Qualifier | Type: Char | Core: Exp | Class: Relationship
